{{Infobox person | name = Jase Robertson | image = Jase Robertson, State Farm, 2013.jpg | caption = Jase Robertson in 2013 | television = ''[[Duck Dynasty]]'' | birth_name = Jason Silas Robertson | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1969|8|16}} | birth_place = [[Bernice, Louisiana]], U.S. | occupation = [[Chief operating officer|COO]] of [[Duck Commander]], businessman, television personality | height = 6 feet | weight = 160 pounds | spouse = Melissa Robertson (1990-present) | children = Reed Robertson
Cole Robertson
Mia Robertson | parents = [[Phil Robertson|Phil Alexander Robertson]]
[[Kay Robertson|Marsha Kay Robertson]] | relatives = Alan Robertson (brother)
[[Willie Robertson]] (brother)
Jeptha Robertson (brother)
[[Silas Robertson]] (uncle)
[[Sadie Robertson]] (niece) | years_active = }} '''Jason Silas''' "'''Jase'''" '''Robertson''' (born August 16, 1969) is an American television star on the [[A&E (TV channel)|A&E]] reality television show ''[[Duck Dynasty]]'', the COO of the business [[Duck Commander]], an innovator, and a professional duck hunter. Jase Robertson lives in [[West Monroe, Louisiana]]{{Citation needed|date=March 2013}} with his wife, Missy, and his three children Reed, Cole and Mia.[http://www.aetv.com/duck-dynasty/robertson-family-tree ''Robertson Family Tree''], aetv.com; retrieved June 26, 2013. He is known for avoiding work in favor of hunting and fishing, speaking "duckinese", and for his self-proclaimed frog-hunting abilities. He calls himself "a [[frog]]'s worst nightmare".{{cite web|url=http://www.newsday.com/entertainment/tv/duck-dynasty-duck-calls-enrich-family-1.3607727|title='Duck Dynasty': Duck calls enrich family |publisher=Newsday|accessdate=May 13, 2014}} ==Childhood== {{BLP unsourced section|date=June 2016}} Jase Robertson was born to [[Phil Robertson|Phil]] and Marsha "Kay" Robertson in [[Bernice, Louisiana]]. His parents gave him the middle name of ''Silas'', naming him after his uncle [[Silas Robertson]], Phil's brother. Jase also has 3 brothers Alan, Willie, and Jeptha. Growing up with his father as the town's ''Duck Commander'', Jase wanted to spend as much time with him as possible, going on various hunting expeditions to strengthen their bond. Soon, Robertson developed the same passion for the sport that his dad has. From the age of eight, Robertson wanted to spend as much time in the rugged lifestyle in the woods as possible, even missing the maximum possible amount of school days as allowed by Louisiana law. ==Business with Duck Commander== {{one source|section|date=June 2016}} With his brother [[Willie Robertson|Willie]] as the CEO of the business, Jase Robertson is the COO of [[Duck Commander]]. Robertson's job at [[Duck Commander]] is to fabricate the duck calls made by the company, fine-tune them, and to invent new ones.[http://www.aetv.com/duck-dynasty/meet-family/jase-robertson Jase Robertson profile], aetv.com; accessed June 14, 2016. It takes him about two to three minutes to make one duck call. One of Jase's inventions is a duck call called the "Triple Threat", a duck call which utilizes three reeds instead of the usual two.{{citation needed|date=June 2016}} ==''Duck Dynasty''== Jase Robertson is one of the stars of [[A&E (TV channel)|A&E]]'s reality show ''[[Duck Dynasty]]''. He is portrayed as a foil for [[Willie Robertson]], and often acts as a mischief maker. Jase said he thought that the show would never take off as a popular series. He stated in an interview with Fox News's Todd Starnes that:
I was one of the ones who said the reality show would never work...We were in the hunting world. I had this perception of reality shows that you had to have all this friction and fits of rage and four-letter words...We're pretty calm compared to that...We've got some crazy characters in our family — but I didn't think people would want to see that.[http://nation.foxnews.com/2013/06/14/starnes-exclusive-duck-dynasty-faith-family-and-facial-hair "Starnes Exclusive: 'Duck Dynasty' on Faith, Family and Facial Hair"], foxnews.com; retrieved June 26, 2013.
==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *{{Twitter}} {{Duck Commander}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Robertson, Jace}} [[Category:1969 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:American members of the Churches of Christ]] [[Category:Louisiana Republicans]] [[Category:Participants in American reality television series]] [[Category:People from Bernice, Louisiana]] [[Category:People from West Monroe, Louisiana]] [[Category:Robertson family]] [[Category:American chief operating officers]]

{{Infobox musical artist <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject Musicians --> | name = Jayso | image = | caption = | background = solo_singer <!-- mandatory format: please do not change or remove --> | birth_name = Paul Nuamah Donkor | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|df=yes|1983|6|1}} | birth_place = [[Adenta]], [[Accra]], Ghana | instrument = [[Keyboard instrument|Keyboard]], [[Sampler (musical instrument)|sampler]] | occupation = [[Record producer]], [[Rapper]], [[Singer]], [[Record executive]], [[Sound Engineer]], | years_active = 2002–present | genre = [[Hip hop music|Hip hop]], | label = Skillions Records | associated_acts = [[Sarkodie (rapper)|Sarkodie]], [[Kwaw Kese]], [[Ball J]], [[Kobi Onyame]], [[Asem]], [[Ayigbe Edem]], [[C-Real (rapper)|C-Real]], [[Wyclef Jean]], [[M.anifest]], [[Kuli Chana]], [[AKA (rapper)|AKA]] | website = }}
'''Paul "Jayso" Nuamah Donkor''' (born June 1, 1983) is a Ghanaian rapper, record producer, singer, songwriter and entrepreneur. After 10 years in the music industry as a rapper and producer, Jayso gained more attention following his work on [[Sarkodie (rapper)|Sarkodie]]'s second single, Borga, which featured on his debut album, Maakye. Jayso produced over 70 percent of the songs on that album which also shot him into the limelight.<ref>{{cite web|title=Passion Turned Business|url=http://notionafrica.com/passion-turn-business-jayso-founderceo-of-skillions-records-record-producer-rapper-singer-and-sound-engineer/|website=www.notionafrica.com|publisher=Notion Africa|accessdate=12 August 2016}}</ref>
[[File:Jayso performs at Sabolai Radio.jpg|thumb|Jayso performs at Sabolai Radio #SabolaiRadio]]
==Early life== During Jayso's teenage years at [[Presbyterian Boys' Senior High School]] (PRESEC-Legon) he formed Skillions, a critically acclaimed hip hop musical collective whose works not only served as the foundation and springboard for young artists to venture into hip hop, but also introduced locally brewed hip hop to the larger Ghanaian music community. Prior to this, Jayso joined another rapper producer JPE (now Kobi Onyame) with his friends Canz and Mr. Scratch to form the Haatsville Project. This resulted in the release of the Haatsville Project mixtape, which got a lot of people talking about it within the underground hip hop circuits of Ghana.<ref>{{cite web|title=Skillions Record Then and Now|url=http://ameyawdebrah.com/get-familiar-skillions-records-then-and-now/|website=www.ameyawdebrah.com|publisher=Ameyaw Debrah Media|accessdate=12 August 2016}}</ref>
His current production credits include [[Sarkodie (rapper)|Sarkodie]], [[M.anifest]], [[Sway (musician)|Sway]], [[Scientific]], [[Kwaw Kese]], Jon Germain, [[Efya]], Rumor and Nigerian MCs [[Naeto C]] and Ikechukwu and Gabonese artiste Baponga.<ref name=all1>{{cite web|title=All You Need To Know About Jayso And Skillions Record|url=https://www.newsghana.com.gh/all-you-need-to-know-about-jayso-and-skillions-record/|website=www.newsghana.com.gh|publisher=News Ghana|accessdate=12 August 2016}}</ref> On 10 December 2015, he released his debut album titled 'Making Tasha Proud' after over half a decade producing for others.<ref name=stream1>{{cite web|title=Stream Jayso's Debut Album 'Making Tasha Proud'|url=http://livefmghana.com/2015/12/10/stream-jaysos-debut-album-making-tasha-proud/|website=www.livefmghana.com|publisher=Live FM|accessdate=12 August 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=#NewsXMuse: Jayso releases tracklisting for new album, 'Making Tasha Proud'|url=http://museafrica.com/blog/2015/11/27/newsxmuse-jayso-releases-tracklisting-for-new-album-making-tasha-proud/|website=www.museafrica.com|publisher=Muse Media Networks|accessdate=12 August 2016}}</ref>
[[File:Hammer Of The Last Two 3.JPG|thumb|320px|Hammer Of The Last Two 3]]
==Early Career/ Music career== Jayso's relationship with music began during his childhood years. During Jayso's High School days at (Presec-Legon) he began to hone his skills first as a rapper and music producer. Prior to joining Haatsville, Jayso was rhyming with his pal T-Kube, who left [[Ghana]] for the UK in 2002 while in high school. He, together with JPE (now Kobi Onyame), Canz and Mr. Scratch (the Haatsville crew) put out the Haatsville Project tape. The tape received acclaim among hip hop lovers who were mostly the youth.<ref>{{cite web|title=Haatsville records|url=http://www.afrisson.com/Haatsville-Records-17089.html|website=www.afrisson.com|publisher=Afrisson|accessdate=12 August 2016}}</ref> Having built on his production knowledge courtesy of his association with Haatsville, Jayso started recruiting what eventually became the first hip hop group Skillions (Skills in a Million). Enlisting [[Ball J]], Jinx Therapy (now Frank P) as the original members of the Skillions, the likes of [[EL (rapper)|EL]], Midnight, J-Town, KP and Sandyswiz joined the Skillions family.<ref>{{cite web|title=Get Familiar: Skillions Records then and now!!!|url=http://ameyawdebrah.com/get-familiar-skillions-records-then-and-now/|website=www.ameyawdebrah.com|publisher=Ameyaw Debrah Media|accessdate=12 August 2016}}</ref>
Under the production supervision of Jayso (who could be described as the Ghanaian version of America's [[RZA]] of Skillions) the group released their ground-breaking 21 track debut 'Skillions Demotapes" mixtape in 2002. The recording of the mixtape happened entirely within the makeshift bedroom studio of Jayso. That tape gained a lot of success that led to the whole GH-Rap Movement.<ref name=all1/> The success of the mixtape was largely due to the production works and the style of music; they rapped mostly in English interspersed with pidgin (a Ghanaian version of broken English and local dialects) - which appealed to a large section of the youth. This eventually cemented Skillions' credentials as one of the talented rap groups of their time in Ghana. Even following the disbandment of the group, each Skillionaire is out making a name for himself within the music and arts scene. The breakup of the Skillions allowed them to pursue solo projects and led to Jayso forming another generation of Skillions. The New Generation comprised Lil Shaker, Rumour, Kevin Beats, Graffik, Killmatic, Padlock, Sandra, Gemini, Nobel and Joey B. The New Generation under the supervision of Jayso released 'The Skillions New Generation Mixtape' with hit songs such as 'Hood', 'Alert', 'Facebook Girl and Boy", 'I No Dey Biz' under his Skillion Records Imprint.<ref>{{cite web|title=Skillions Mixtape Out|url=https://www.modernghana.com/music/10530/skillions-mixtape-out.html|website=www.modernghana.com|publisher=Modern Ghana|accessdate=12 August 2016}}</ref>
Jayso has worked with almost every notable artiste within the music sphere in Ghana since 1999. Outside of Ghana, he has worked for one of hip hop legends [[Wyclef Jean]] and UK's [[Sway (musician)|Sway]]. Locally, he has produced works for the like of [[Sarkodie (rapper)|Sarkodie]], [[M.anifest]], [[R2Bees]], [[Efya]], [[Kwaw Kese]], Afro Rock Band Dark Suburb, VIP, [[Reggie Rockstone]], ASEM among others.<ref>{{cite web|title=Jayso Opens New Studio|url=http://www.peacefmonline.com/pages/showbiz/music/201301/152440.php|website=www.peacefmonline.com|publisher=Peacefmonline|accessdate=12 August 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Lay Away (feat. Sway & Jayso)|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/music/records/n4z68b|website=www.bbc.co.uk|publisher=BBC|accessdate=12 August 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Jayso, Sarkodie and Efya team up to release short film for I'm In Love With Your Girlfriend|url=http://entertainment.myjoyonline.com/pages/news/201305/106721.php|website=www.myjoyonline.com|publisher=Multimedia Group|accessdate=12 August 2016}}</ref>
==Discography==
===Albums=== * Making Tasha Proud (2016) <ref name=stream1/> * 0106 Vol 1 (2016) * 0106 Vol 2 (2017) * 0106 Vol 3 (2018)
==References== {{reflist}}
{{authority control}}

It airs a business talk format. The station is owned by CRC Broadcasting. KPSF signed on March 5, 2012.{{cite news|title=Money Radio 1200 To Debut In Palm Springs|url=http://www.allaccess.com/net-news/archive/story/103071/money-radio-1200-to-debut-in-palm-springs|accessdate=February 6, 2017|work=All Access|date=March 2, 2012|language=en}} The station shares its transmitter site with sister station [[KXPS]], and its format is modeled on Phoenix sister station [[KFNN]].{{cite news|last1=Marcucci|first1=Carl|title=KPSF-AM Palm Springs signs on air|url=http://rbr.com/kpsf-am-palm-springs-signs-on-air/|accessdate=February 6, 2017|work=Radio Business Report|date=March 5, 2012}} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *{{official website|moneyradio1200.com}} {{AM station data|KPSF}} *{{FMQ|K265FH}} *{{FXL|K265FH}} {{Palm Springs Radio}} [[Category:Radio stations in California|PSF]] [[Category:Business talk radio stations]] [[Category:Radio stations established in 2012]] [[Category:2012 establishments in California]] [[Category:Business media in the United States]] {{California-radio-station-stub}}

revision.text:
{{Infobox person | name = Karol Pollak | image = Karol Pollak.jpg | imagesize = 220px | caption = Karol Pollak, ''Polish Edison'' | birth_date = {{Birth date|mf=yes|1859|11|15}} | birth_name = Karol Franciszek Pollak | birth_place = [[Sanok]], [[Poland]] | death_date = {{Death date and age|mf=yes|1928|12|17|1859|11|15}} | death_place = [[Bielsko-Biała]], [[Poland]] | occupation = Inventor, businessman | education = | nationality = [[Polish people|Polish]] | spouse = | religion = | partner = | children = | relatives = | signature = | website = | footnotes = }}
'''Karol Franciszek Pollak''' (November 15, 1859 – December 17, 1928) was a [[Polish people|Polish]] [[electrotechnician]], [[inventor]] and [[businessman]].
== Early life == He was born in [[Sanok]], [[Poland]]. His father was Karol Pollak (1818–80) who was a [[printer (publishing)|printer]], bookseller and publisher, well known in [[Sanok]]. Karol (not to be mistaken with his father) worked in his youth as an [[electrician]] and showed great technical skills in it. In 1883 he was employed in the laboratory of British company "The Patent Utilisation Co". He designed and recorded his first patents in that period. In 1885 he attended [[electrotechnics]] studies at the [[Berlin Institute of Technology|Royal Polytechnic University in Charlottenburg]].
== Activity == In Berlin, Pollak ran electrotechnical factory "G. Wehr Telegraphen-Bau-Anstalt". Later he returned to Britain to commercialize his patents, which were released under anglicised version of his name, "Charles Pollak". In 1886, he became the director of a Paris company of electric tramways of his design. In the meantime he worked on the design of [[Electrochemical cell]]. He was very successful in this topic and it made him famous. Later he founded battery factories in [[Frankfurt]], [[Germany]] and [[Liesing]], [[Austria]]. Many battery-manufacturing companies have licensed his designs.
In 1899 he founded his own laboratory and proceeded with further research. He obtained 98 patents on his inventions.
In 1922 he returned to [[Poland]], where a year later he founded a factory in [[Biała Krakowska|Biała]], which exists to the present day.<ref>[http://www.www.hawker.pl/pl/fabryka Fabryka Akumulatorów EnerSys Sp. z o.o]</ref> The company started under the name of ''Polskie Towarzystwo Akumulatorowe'' and was co-founded by professor and president of [[Poland]], [[Ignacy Mościcki]]. However, Pollak was the first president of this company.
Pollak is sometimes referred as the ''Edison of Poland''. In 1925 he received the title [[Doctor Honoris Causa|doctor honoris causa]] of [[Warsaw Polytechnic|Warsaw University of Technology]].
== Most important inventions == [[File:Pollak akumulator.jpg|thumb|150px|Battery constructed by Karol Pollak]] His numerous inventions also cover other areas, among them: [[electric motor]]s, [[color printing]] device, and a type of [[microphone]]. His main activity was related to [[chemical energy|chemical sources of energy]] - [[galvanic cell]]s and batteries. He obtained a patent for manufacturing [[Lead acid battery|lead-acid batteries]].
[[File:Pollak bridge.png|thumb|250px|Design of full rectifier included in Karol Pollak patent]] He also has designed [[Rectifier|commutator and electrolytic rectifiers]]. In 1895 he was the first to suggest the use of [[Diode bridge|full bridge diode rectification circuit]],<ref>British patent [https://archive.is/20130807121725/https://depatisnet.dpma.de/DepatisNet/depatisnet?window=1&space=menu&content=treffer&action=bibdat&docid=GB000189524398A 24398]</ref> later known by [[Leo Graetz]]. In 1896, Pollak invented the [[electrolytic capacitor]]<ref>German patent [http://depatisnet.dpma.de/DepatisNet/depatisnet?action=pdf&docid=DE000000092564A D.R.P. 92564].</ref>
== References == {{reflist}}
== Bibliography == {{Refbegin}} * {{Cite book |title=Encyklopedia |publisher=PWN |volume=Vol. 2 |location=Warszawa |year=1991}} * {{Cite book |title=Słownik polskich pionierów techniki |first=Jerzy |last=Kubiatowski |location=Katowice |year=1984 |pages=166–167}} {{Refend}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Pollak, Karol}} [[Category:1859 births]] [[Category:1928 deaths]] [[Category:Polish businesspeople]] [[Category:Polish inventors]] [[Category:People associated with electricity]] [[Category:Businesspeople in electricity]]

[[MSG Plus 2]] | timeshift names = | web = {{URL|http://www.msgnetworks.com/}} | sat serv 1 = [[DirecTV]] | sat chan 1 = 635-1 (HD/SD) Sabres games and select Bills and Sabres programming only | sat serv 2 = [[Bell TV]] | sat chan 2 = 442 (as Sabres TV) | cable serv 1 = [[Spectrum (cable service)|Spectrum]] {{small|([[Buffalo, NY|Buffalo]])}} | cable chan 1 = 48 | cable serv 2 = Spectrum {{small|([[Rochester, NY|Rochester]])}} | cable chan 2 = 51 | cable serv 3 = [[Verizon Fios]] {{small|([[Western New York]])}} | cable chan 3 = 77 or 80 (SD)
577 (HD) | cable serv 4 = [[Atlantic Broadband]] {{small|([[Salamanca, New York|Salamanca]]/[[Bradford, Pennsylvania|Bradford]])}} | cable chan 4 = 39 (SD)
739 (HD) | adsl serv 1 = | adsl chan 1 = | adsl serv 2 = | adsl chan 2 = | iptv serv 1 = [[Frontier Communications|Frontier Vantage]] {{small|([[Rochester, New York|Rochester]])}}http://13wham.com/news/top-stories/competition-for-cable-services-coming-to-rochester-area | iptv chan 1 = TBD | online serv 1 = [[FuboTV]] | online chan 1 = [[IPTV|Internet Protocol television]] }} '''MSG Western New York''' (MSG WNY) is an [[United States|American]] [[regional sports network]] that is a joint venture between [[MSG Networks]] and [[Pegula Sports and Entertainment]]. The channel (also on occasion credited as ''Pegula Sports Network'' or ''MSG Buffalo'') is a sub-feed of [[MSG (TV network)|MSG Network]], with programming oriented towards the [[Western New York]] region, including coverage of the [[National Hockey League]]'s [[Buffalo Sabres]] and the [[National Football League]]'s [[Buffalo Bills]]. It replaced MSG Network on television providers in the Sabres' media market in 2016. MSG Western New York is available on [[cable television|cable]] providers throughout Western New York. Most programming is available nationwide on [[direct broadcast satellite|satellite]] via [[DirecTV]], with Sabres games requiring an [[NHL Center Ice]] subscription for out of market viewers; select programs are carried in Canada's [[Niagara Peninsula]] on a special channel set up for [[Bell TV]] subscribers that was founded in 2013. ==History== After the collapse of [[Empire Sports Network]] and its parent [[Adelphia Communications Corporation|Adelphia]],{{cite web|title=Adelphia adds NFL Net|url=https://variety.com/2005/tv/news/adelphia-adds-nfl-net-1117918998/|author=John Dempsey|periodical=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|publisher=Reed Business Information|date=March 6, 2005|accessdate=April 12, 2015}} MSG bought the rights to the [[Buffalo Sabres]] in 2006 under a 10-year deal; where telecasts are controlled by the team via the [[Sabres Hockey Network]], including the sale of advertising, and the simulcast of [[Rick Jeanneret]]'s commentary on both radio and television (although, during the 2015-16 season, the team experimented with having separate commentary teams on radio and television for selected games, which the ''[[Buffalo News]]'' speculated was in preparation for Jeanneret's eventual retirement), conditions that the Sabres always make as part of their telecast deals going back to the days of Empire.{{cite web|url=http://sabres.nhl.com/club/news.htm?id=437214|title=Sabres Extend MSG Contract|date=September 1, 2006|work=Buffalo Sabres|accessdate=June 24, 2016}}{{cite web|title=Sabres in strong negotiation position as TV, radio deals near end|url=http://talkintv.buffalonews.com/2016/01/07/sabres-in-strong-negotiation-position-as-tv-radio-deals-near-end/|website=Buffalo News|accessdate=25 June 2016}} After acquiring the rights, MSG divided its network into three regional broadcast "zones"; Sabres games were available within "Zone 3", which covered Buffalo and Rochester, and "Zone 2", the remainder of the state excluding Buffalo, Rochester, and New York City—which was shared by the Sabres, Devils, Islanders, and Rangers. The exact channel assignment for Sabres games varied by region (some games were carried by [[MSG Plus|FSN New York]] in Zone 2), but all games were carried on the main MSG Network service within Zone 3.{{cite web|title=2005-2006 NHL Telecast Schedule|url=https://www.nhl.com/sabres/news/2005-2006-nhl-telecast-schedule/c-436903|website=Buffalo Sabres official website|publisher=NHL, [[MLB Advanced Media]]|accessdate=18 October 2016}}{{cite web|title=Buffalo Sabres 2005-2006 NHL Telecast Schedule|url=http://cdn.nhl.com/sabres/bc/images/buffalo_pages/pdf/SabresTVSchedule.pdf|publisher=Buffalo Sabres|accessdate=18 October 2016}} The Buffalo Sabres' regional television [[Nielsen ratings|ratings]] are among the highest in the league; in the 2015-16 season, despite the team's poor overall performance, fan enthusiasm over star prospect [[Jack Eichel]] helped the team achieve the highest average regional viewership of all NHL teams for the first time since 2008-09, with a 6.55 share. National telecasts on [[NBC]] and [[NBCSN]] have also had notably high ratings in Buffalo.{{cite web|title=Sabres end Penguins’ reign atop RSN ratings|url=http://www.sportsbusinessdaily.com/Journal/Issues/2016/04/18/Media/NHL-RSNs.aspx|website=Sports Business Journal|accessdate=June 23, 2016}}{{cite web|title=Buffalo is No. 1 market for hockey ratings despite 35 percent drop in year|url=http://talkintv.buffalonews.com/2015/04/14/buffalo-is-no-1-market-for-hockey-ratings-despite-40-percent-drop-in-year/|website=Buffalo News|accessdate=June 23, 2016}} It was speculated that Pegula Sports and Entertainment, which had recently bought the Sabres, [[Rochester Americans]], [[Buffalo Bandits]] and [[Buffalo Bills]], was planning to take advantage of the high viewership by establishing a team-owned regional sports network once the Sabres' existing television contract with MSG expired. The ''Buffalo News''{{'}}s Alan Pergament also acknowledged the impending end of the Sabres and Bills' radio contracts with [[WGR]] as a possibility that the group could, potentially, acquire a radio station to serve as a team-owned radio outlet if it is unable to renew its contract with [[Entercom]] (Entercom had purchased the Sabres' previous owned-and-operated station, 107.7 [[WLKK|WNSA]], in 2004, and merged its remaining programming onto WGR). Pegula eventually secured a contract extension with Entercom keeping the Bills and Sabres on WGR through the spring of 2021.{{cite web|url=http://www.bizjournals.com/buffalo/news/2016/09/09/entercom-buffalo-to-keep-broadcasting-bills-sabres.html|last=Fink|first=James|work=Business First|date=September 9, 2016|accessdate=September 9, 2016|title=Entercom Buffalo to keep broadcasting Bills, Sabres on radio}} However, in regards to television, he felt that it was more likely for Pegula to partner with MSG to form a full-time, Buffalo-specific feed of MSG Network with additional local programming, rather than actually establishing a new, standalone outlet.{{cite web|title=Are the Pegulas hiring for their own regional sports network?|url=http://www.diebytheblade.com/2016/6/15/11943104/are-pegulas-hiring-for-western-new-york-regional-sports-network|website=Die By The Blade (SB Nation)|publisher=Vox Media|accessdate=June 23, 2016}} {{quote box|align=left|width=200px|"Basically, what we have done is create our own platform, which is stronger because we already have the distribution on MSG, we have the benefit of MSG programming on there and the benefit of the platform of producing as much programming as we feel comfortable."|author = Mark Preisler}} On June 20, 2016, Pegula announced that it had entered into a joint venture with MSG to establish a new service known as MSG Western New York. The channel, a sub-feed of MSG Network took over the former MSG Zone 3/Sabres game only channel, replacing the parent channel within the Sabres existing television market—which was also, notably, expanded to include the entirety of [[Rochester, New York|Rochester]]. The arrangement allows Pegula access to MSG's existing distribution and statewide programming, while allowing opt-outs for an expanded slate of local programming dedicated to the Bills and Sabres, which is produced and controlled by Pegula. MSG as part of the agreement pays $19 to $20 million per-year in rights fees to broadcast Sabres games and programming, as well as Buffalo Bills programming; it is nearly double the value of the previous Sabres deal. As with the previous deal, Pegula controls team programming on the network, including advertising sales and production (which is handled through PSE's production wing PicSix Creative), and receives all advertising revenue, while MSG collects the [[retransmission consent]] fee. Besides original programming and broadcasts exclusive to MSG WNY, the network also carries selected programming from the main MSG Network channel.{{cite news|last=Pergament|first=Alan|title=Wide-ranging deal will keep Sabres – and other Pegula Sports & Entertainment content – on MSG|url=http://sabres.buffalonews.com/2016/06/20/wide-ranging-deal-will-keep-sabres-and-other-pegula-sports-entertainment-content-on-msg/|accessdate=June 22, 2016|work=[[The Buffalo News]]|publisher=[[Berkshire Hathaway]]|date=June 21, 2016}} Pegula's executive vice president of media and content Mark Preisler explained that the deal was an alternative to establishing a new regional sports network from scratch, as the company would be able to expand on its relationship with MSG as a long-standing partner by leveraging its infrastructure and distribution, rather than needing to invest in building a network and negotiating carriage with television providers.{{cite news|last=Fink|first=James|title=Pegula Sports and Entertainment, MSG Networks seal new, long-term deal|url=http://www.bizjournals.com/buffalo/blog/morning_roundup/2016/06/pegula-sports-and-entertainment-msg-networks-seal.html|accessdate=June 22, 2016|work=Buffalo Business First|publisher=[[American City Business Journals]]|date=June 21, 2016}} The first promos seen for the channel ran during a Bills preseason game against the [[Indianapolis Colts]] on August 13, 2016 promoting its Bills programming. The channel debuted on September 10, 2016 at 8:00pm with a Western New York cut in showing the 2016 debut of ''The Rex Ryan Show'' and a special behind the scenes feature called ''Rex and Rob Reunited'' at 8:30 and 9pm, the daily feed followed on October 3.http://talkintv.buffalonews.com/2016/09/07/bills-preseason-rating-drop-25-percent-in-a-year-dedes-and-wilcots-call-opener-at-baltimore/ On April 4, 2017, news broke that [[James L. Dolan]], controlling owner of MSG, was exploring the sale of his regional sports networks, including his share of MSG Western New York.https://nypost.com/2017/04/03/msg-networks-is-looking-to-sell/ ==Programming== The network carries team programming related to the Buffalo Sabres and Buffalo Bills; the former including all 70 regional Sabres games and the latter including local Bills shows formerly aired by [[WKBW-TV]]; preseason telecasts began to be simulcast with WKBW beginning in 2017. In addition, the channel simulcasts ''The Instigators'' (formerly known as ''Sabres Hockey Hotline'')https://www.nhl.com/sabres/news/the-instigators-premieres-tuesday-on-wgr-550-and-msg/c-282245416 and ''One Bills Live'' (formerly known as ''The John Murphy Show'') from [[WGR]] radio as part of a five-hour weekday block, originating from studios (dubbed the ''One Buffalo studios'') at [[New Era Field]]; Murphy's program was moved from the evening to the afternoon and had a co-host added. As an aspect of the overall deal, PSE agreed in principle to extend its radio rights with WGR. MSG Western New York added a package of five [[Rochester Americans]] contests beginning in December 2016, moving the team's television broadcasts to MSG WNY from the moribund [[Spectrum Sports (New York)|Time Warner Cable Sports Channel]].http://www.amerks.com/article/AMERKS%20ANNOUNCE%202016-17%20TELEVISION%20SCHEDULE On September 7, 2017, it was announced that the channel would begin airing select [[Monsignor Martin Athletic Association]] high school football games produced by Pegula as part of a multi-year deal, including a three-game showcase at New Era FIeld.[http://buffalonews.com/2017/09/07/pegula-sports-entertainment-set-air-series-monsignor-martin-football-games/ Pegula Sports and Entertainment set to air series of Monsignor Martin football games]. ''The Buffalo News'' (September 7, 2017). Retrieved September 15, 2017. The high school coverage moved exclusively online for 2018.https://www.buffalobills.com/news/monsignor-martin-high-school-football-returns-to-new-era-field Other programs will be added as the channel expands. The remainder of MSG WNY's schedule consists of programming from the main [[MSG (TV network)|MSG Network]] schedule, such as [[New York Knicks]] basketball. In turn, MSG also has rights to air the Pegula-produced original programming and game converge on its other networks.Pergament, Alan (June 21, 2016). [http://talkintv.buffalonews.com/2016/06/21/12-opinions-msg-pegula-sports-deal/ 12 opinions on the MSG-Pegula Sports deal]. Retrieved June 21, 2016. In 2018, MSG-produced Bills preseason telecasts moved to the stations of [[Nexstar Media Group]] in all media markets outside Buffalo. As the Bills could not break their existing contract with WKBW in Buffalo, the rights in that city will not change until 2020, when Nexstar-owned [[WIVB-TV]] will begin carrying the games.https://buffalonews.com/2018/08/02/fred-jackson-to-join-bills-post-game-show-catalana-replaced-on-sidelines/ ===Original programming=== ===Hockey=== * ''Beyond Blue & Gold'' — a periodical Sabres magazine show that debuted in 2013http://www.buffalobroadcasters.com/news/Industry-News:--Revised-radio-ratings-with-public-stations-numbers/34 * ''The Instigators'' — daily talk show co-hosted by [[Andrew Peters]] and [[Craig Rivet]] with regular contributor [[Martin Biron]]; simulcast on [[WGR]] (formerly known as ''Sabres Hockey Hotline'', Tuesday through Friday) * ''Sabres Showdown'' — short-form [[penalty shootout]] knockout tournament featuring Sabres stars, based on the 1970s-era ''[[NHL on NBC]]''/''[[Hockey Night in Canada]]'' feature of the same name ===Football=== * ''The [[Sean McDermott]] Show'' — weekly coach's show hosted by [[John Murphy (announcer)|John Murphy]] and head coach Sean McDermott. * ''Bills All-Access'' — weekly half-hour newsmagazine * ''Bills Tonight'' — weekly postgame show * ''One Bills Live'' — daily talk show co-hosted by John Murphy and [[Steve Tasker]]; simulcast on WGR (formerly known as ''The John Murphy Show''){{Cite news|url=http://buffalonews.com/2018/04/11/the-john-murphy-show-becomes-one-bills-live-with-tasker-as-co-host/|title='The John Murphy Show' becomes 'One Bills Live' with Tasker as co-host|last=Veronica|first=Nick|date=2018-04-11|work=The Buffalo News|access-date=2018-04-11|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.buffalobills.com/news/article-1/Bills-legend-Steve-Tasker-returns-to-roots-as-he-joins-%E2%80%9COne-Bills-Live%E2%80%9D/4b6c1a75-26de-44e7-921b-70a169aab0e8|title=Bills legend Steve Tasker returns to roots as he joins "One Bills Live"|last=Baker|first=Kelly|date=2018-04-11|work=BuffaloBills.com|access-date=2018-04-11|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=}} * ''Top 10 in Bills History'' — countdown [[miniseries]]; debuted June 12, 2017http://buffalonews.com/2017/06/12/let-debates-begin-top-10-moments-bills-history-airs-msg-tonight/ * ''The Extra Point'' — Monday radio show simulcast with WGR * ''Buffalo Bills: Embedded'' — Documentary series covering the Bills [[National Football League training camp|training camp]]; debuted August 2018, created by MSG WNY for [[Facebook Watch]]https://buffalonews.com/2018/08/23/bills-embedded-improves-and-local-tv-wins-in-27th-congressional-district/ ==On-air staff== ===Current on-air staff=== ====Football==== * Chris Brown — contributor to ''Bills All Access'' and high school play-by-play * [[Ruben Brown]] — analyst for ''Bills Tonight'' * [[Thad Brown (broadcaster)|Thad Brown]] — preseason sideline reporter * Sal Capaccio — host of ''The Extra Point'' * [[Andrew Catalon]] — Bills preseason play-by-play (rotating) * [[Fred Jackson (American football)|Fred Jackson]] — analyst for ''Bills Tonight'' * Len Jankiewicz — high school color commentary * [[John Murphy (announcer)|John Murphy]] — host of ''One Bills Live'' and ''The Sean McDermott Show'' * [[Rob Stone (sportscaster)|Rob Stone]] — Bills preseason play-by-play (rotating) * [[Steve Tasker]] — host of ''Bills All Access'', co-host of ''One Bills Live'' and Bills preseason color commentator ====Hockey==== {{main|List of Buffalo Sabres broadcasters}} * [[Martin Biron]] – Sabres studio analyst * [[Brian Duff (broadcaster)|Brian Duff]] – Sabres studio host * [[Dan Dunleavy]] – Sabres play-by-play announcer * [[Danny Gare]] – Sabres fill-in analyst * [[Rick Jeanneret]] – Sabres play-by-play announcer * [[Rob Ray]] – Sabres color analyst * [[Andrew Peters]] – co-host of ''The Instigators'' * [[Craig Rivet]] – co-host of ''The Instigators'' * [[Ric Seiling]] – Amerks color analyst * Don Stevens – Amerks play-by-play announcer ====Multiple sports==== * [[Mike Catalana]] – Amerks bench reporter and host of ''Bills Tonight'' ===Former on-air staff=== * [[Donald Jones (American football)|Donald Jones]] – co-host of ''The John Murphy Showhttp://buffalonews.com/2018/04/03/steve-tasker-to-replace-donald-jones-on-john-murphy-show/ * [[Brad May]] – Sabres studio analyst ==Carriage== ===Cable television=== Both of the two primary cable providers in Western New York, [[Spectrum (cable service)|Spectrum]] (formerly [[Time Warner Cable]], which covers the vast majority of the state) and [[Atlantic Broadband]] (which covers a small portion of [[Cattaraugus County]]) have carried the network from its inception. ===DirecTV=== On August 10, 2016, the debut night of MSG Western New York it was revealed that [[DirecTV]] would not be running the network's full programming schedule.https://twitter.com/chellegz/status/774717839764848640?lang=en The Sabres noted that MSG made the programming available to DirecTV but the provider was not willing to carry it.https://twitter.com/BuffaloSabres/status/783311474345316353?lang=en This made MSG WNY a part-time channel on DirecTV with the provider continuing to air the channel as a game only service showing Sabres games only. For the [[2017 NFL season]], DirecTV began showing ''Bills All Acesss'' and irregularly showing the first runs of ''The Sean McDermott Show'' and ''Bills Tonight'' in addition to the Sabres games that the channel airs. A week later DirecTV began showing ''The Instigators'' and ''The John Murphy Show''. DirecTV happens to be the service that Pegula owned properties like 716 Food and Sport, a sports bar and grill in downtown Buffalo use. ===Dish Network=== MSG Western New York, like [[MSG (TV network)|MSG]] and [[MSG Plus]], is unavailable on [[Dish Network]]. As part of an ongoing feud with the family of [[Charles Dolan]] (owners of MSG), Dish has not carried any MSG network channel since the last agreement expired on October 1, 2010.{{cite web|url=http://www.buffalonews.com/sports/article207853.ece|title=Dish NEtwork Drops MSG|date=2010-10-01|work=Buffalo News}} ===Over-the-top services=== [[FuboTV]] added the MSG networks for the fall 2017 season.{{cite web|url=http://www.broadcastingcable.com/news/distribution/fubotv-adds-msg-networks/168908 |title=fuboTV Adds MSG Networks |website= broadcastingcable.com |date=2017-09-26 |accessdate=2017-11-03}} ==See also== *[[Sabres Hockey Network]] *[[Buffalo Bills Radio Network]] *[[Spectrum Sports (New York)|Spectrum Sports]] *[[MSG Plus]] ==References== {{reflist|30em}} {{Buffalo Sabres}} {{Buffalo Bills}} {{Pegula Sports and Entertainment}} {{Madison Square Garden Company}} {{Buffalo TV}} {{Rochester TV}} {{Toronto TV}} {{Sports television in the United States}} {{National Hockey League on national television}} [[Category:Sports television networks in the United States]] [[Category:Sports in Buffalo, New York]] [[Category:Television channels and stations established in 2016]] [[Category:Buffalo Sabres broadcasters]] [[Category:Buffalo Bills broadcasters]] [[Category:Madison Square Garden Company]] [[Category:Joint ventures]] [[Category:Television stations in Buffalo, New York]] [[Category:2016 establishments in New York (state)]] [[Category:Pegula Sports and Entertainment]]

{{Infobox person | name = Michael Ade-Ojo | image = | imagesize = | alt = | caption = | birth_name =Michael Ade-Ojo | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1938|6|14|df=yes}} | birth_place = [[Ilara-Mokin]], Ondo State, Nigeria | death_date = | death_place = | othername = Elizade | occupation = Entrepreneur, Chairman and CEO Elizade motors limited | yearsactive = 1975 till present | spouse = Mrs Taiwo Ade-ojo(M,2012) | domesticpartner = | website = }}
'''Michael Ade-Ojo''', [[Order of the Niger|OON]] (born June 14, 1938) is a Nigerian [[business magnate]] and founder of [[Elizade University]] in [[Ilara-Mokin]] Ondo state, Nigeria.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.punchng.com/spice/personalities/how-i-found-my-acres-of-diamond-michael-ade-ojo/|title=How I found my acres of diamond — Michael Ade-Ojo|work=The Punch - Nigeria's Most Widely Read Newspaper|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150924133322/http://www.punchng.com/spice/personalities/how-i-found-my-acres-of-diamond-michael-ade-ojo/|archivedate=2015-09-24|df=}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.osundefender.org/?p=90905|title=74yr Old Billionaire Businessman, Chief Adeojo’s Young Wife Gives Birth To Twins|publisher=}}</ref>
==Early life== Chief Michael Ade-Ojo, a westerner from [[Ondo State|Ondo state]] southwestern, [[Nigeria]] was born on June 14, 1938 at [[Ilara-Mokin]], a town in Ondo state into the family of the late chief Solomon Ojo and Mrs. Beatrice Ademolawe Ojo. He attended St. Michael’s Anglican School, [[Ilara-Mokin]], [[Ondo State, Nigeria]]. He later attended Imade College, [[Owo, Nigeria]] (1954-1958), where he obtained the West Africa School Certificate. He proceeded to the [[University of Nigeria, Nsukka]] (UNN) in 1961, where he obtained a Bachelor of Arts (B.A.) degree in [[Business Administration]] in 1965.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thisdaylive.com/articles/golfers-to-honour-ade-ojo/180793/|title=Golfers to Honour Ade-Ojo, Articles - THISDAY LIVE|publisher=|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141023011718/http://www.thisdaylive.com/articles/golfers-to-honour-ade-ojo/180793/|archivedate=2014-10-23|df=}}</ref>
==Fellowship== *Fellow, Academy for Entrepreneurial Studies (F.AES) by [[Ausbeth Ajagu]] <ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.aes-edu.net/board.htm|title=Aes-edu.net|website=www.aes-edu.net|access-date=2018-01-02}}</ref> (2007) *Fellow of [[Lagos State Polytechnic]], Ikorodu, Lagos. 2009
==References== {{Reflist}}
==See also== *[[Elizade University]]
{{DEFAULTSORT:Ade-Ojo, Michael}} [[Category:Yoruba businesspeople]] [[Category:1938 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Nigerian businesspeople]] [[Category:University of Nigeria, Nsukka alumni]] [[Category:People from Ondo State]]

{{BLP sources|date=December 2016}} {{Infobox person | name = Mika Salmi | image = | alt = | caption = | birth_name = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1965|11|16}} | birth_place = [[Finland]] | death_date = <!-- {{Death date and age|YYYY|MM|DD|YYYY|MM|DD}} (death date then birth date) --> | death_place = | nationality = [[Americans|American]] | other_names = | occupation = [[Businessperson]] | years_active = | known_for = | notable_works = }}
'''Mika Salmi''' (born 16 November 1965) is a Finnish-born American entrepreneur, and executive in technology and media.
==Biography== Salmi is a senior advisor at The Raine Group, an investment and advisory firm focused on the media, entertainment and sports industries.<ref name=N>{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2000/06/15/technology/hollywood-flirts-with-short-films-on-the-web.html|title=Hollywood Flirts With Short Films on the Web|author=Houston, Frank|date=June 15, 2000|work=[[The New York Times]]}}</ref> He also serves on the Boards of [[INSEAD]], Trace, Pixvana, [[CreativeLive]], and Feed.fm and actively advises numerous startups.
Prior to Raine, he served as CEO of [[CreativeLive]].{{When|date=January 2017}}.
Salmi promoted [[new media]] as president of global digital media for [[MTV Networks]]/[[Viacom]]. He reported to the chairman and CEO of MTV Networks, [[Judy McGrath]].{{When|date=January 2017}}
Salmi was CEO and founder of [[Atom Entertainment]],<ref name=N/> which was purchased by [[Viacom]] for $200 million in 2006. In 1998 Salmi founded [[Atom.com|AtomFilms]],<ref name=N/> an online film and humor site, which featured artists such as [[Jason Reitman]] and [[JibJab]]. Atom had three brands, AtomFilms, Shockwave and AddictingGames, which together had over 40 million monthly active users. AtomFilms was one of the first and largest online video companies and was the YouTube of its day. Shockwave was the largest game brand on the internet and was complemented by AddictingGames, which was the fastest growing casual games website.
Before founding Atom, Salmi worked at [[RealNetworks]]. Salmi began his entertainment career in the music business, working at [[Sony Music International]], [[EMI Music]] and [[TVT Records]]. While at TVT Records he saw multi-Platinum selling and Grammy winning artist [[Nine Inch Nails]] opening for another band, and asked for a demo tape. He worked with TVT's head of A&R, Kitty Overton, who, with Steve Gottlieb, the founder of TVT, to sign the band.
Other companies where Salmi is serving or has served on the board of directors include [[Inkd]] (acquired by [[RealSelf]]), [[Elisa (company)|Elisa]] (Finland's largest telecom company), [[Blinkbox]] (acquired by Tesco), [[Image Metrics]] (went public), Shockwave KK (acquired by Transcosmos/Japan), and Propel Renewable Fuels (innovator in alternative energy distribution).
Regularly included in lists of industry trailblazers, Salmi has appeared in ''[[Vanity Fair (magazine)|Vanity Fair]]'', ''[[The Hollywood Reporter]]'', ''[[Forbes]]'', ''[[Fortune (magazine)|Fortune]]'', ''[[Wired (magazine)|Wired]]'' and numerous international publications. He has been profiled by ''[[The Wall Street Journal]''], ''[[The New York Times]]'', ''[[Los Angeles Times]]'', ''[[Fortune (magazine)|Fortune]]'', ''[[Newsweek]]'', ''[[USA Today]]'', ''[[Business Week]]'', and several other US and foreign newspapers. Salmi has appeared on television news programs and morning talk shows, including [[ABC News]], [[BBC News]], [[CNN]], [[CNBC]], and [[The Today Show]], and has delivered high profile keynote speeches around the world.
Salmi has an MBA from [http://www.insead.edu INSEAD].
== References == <references />
==External links== *[http://www.thedailybeast.com/newsweek/2008/04/05/i-want-my-web-mtv.html Newsweek profile] *[http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/hr/content_display/news/e3i24c2c1ca26d4ac8d36c4102c5eb5fd57?pn=2 Hollywood Reporter Top 50] *[https://web.archive.org/web/20090830185420/http://www.vanityfair.com/online/newestablishment/2008/09/the-next-establishment-2008.html Vanity Fair "Next Establishment"] *[http://www.businessweek.com/2000/00_20/b3681085.htm Business Week Profile] *[https://www.usatoday.com/life/people08.htm USA Today Profile] *[http://www.businessweek.com/magazine/content/06_12/b3976032.htm 2006 Business Week Profile]

page.title: Mishari bin Saud bin Abdulaziz Al Saud

revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=January 2017}} {{Infobox royalty | title = | image = | caption = | succession = Governor of [[Al Bahah Province]] | reign = 28 August 2010 – present | reign-type = Term | predecessor = [[Muhammed bin Saud]] | successor = | regent = [[Abdullah of Saudi Arabia|King Abdullah]] | reg-type = Monarch | birth_date = {{birth year and age|1954}} | birth_place = Riyadh | spouse = | issue = | full name = Mishari bin Saud bin Abdulaziz Al Saud | house = [[House of Saud]] | father = [[King Saud]] | mother = Naima bint Ubaid | religion = [[Wahhabi]] [[Hanbali]] [[Sunni Islam]] }} '''Mishari bin Saud''' (born 1954) is a retired [[Saudi Arabia]]n military officer, businessman, governor of [[Al Bahah Province]] and a member of [[House of Saud]].
==Early life and education== Mishari bin Saud was born in [[Riyadh]] in December 1954. He is the thirty-second son of [[Saud of Saudi Arabia|King Saud]].<ref name="SaudInCommerce">{{cite book|last=Sharif|first=Sabri|title=The House of Saud in Commerce: A Study of Royal Entrepreneurship in Saudi Arabia,|year=2001|publisher=I. S. Publication|location=New Delhi|isbn=81-901254-0-0|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=51Bb8Ix7xw8C&pg=PA151&lpg=PA151&dq=hala+bint+ahmad+al-sudairi#v=onepage&q=hala%20bint%20ahmad%20al-sudairi&f=false}}</ref> His mother is Naima bint Ubaid.<ref name="kingsaud">{{cite web|title=kingsaud|url=http://www.kingsaud.org/family/meshari-bin-saud-bin-abdulaziz-al-saud/175|accessdate=14 December 2016|language=English}}</ref>
After completing his primary and secondary education in Saudi Arabia in 1971, he went to the US for university education. However, he only completed an eight-month English course there. He returned to Saudi Arabia to receive university education. He has a bachelor of arts degree in history and later, he received a master's degree in history from [[King Saud University]]. The title of his MA thesis was “Relations between Saudi Arabia and Al-Mutawakkaliya Kingdom of Yemen under the reign of King Abdulaziz.”<ref name="SaudInCommerce"/>
==Career== Prince Mishari was a brigade commander in [[Saudi National Guard|the National Guard (SANG)]].<ref name=shenderson94>{{cite web|author=Simon Henderson|title=After King Fahd|url=http://www.washingtoninstitute.org/uploads/Documents/pubs/PP_37_AFTERKINGFAHD.pdf|work=Washington Institute|accessdate=2 February 2013|format=Policy Paper|year=1994}}</ref> In June 1983, he was appointed deputy commander of (SANG) in the [[Eastern Province, Saudi Arabia|Eastern Province]].<ref name="SaudInCommerce"/> He headed the SANG in the province<ref>{{cite book|author=Bharat Verma|title=Indian Defence Review|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=BVl0ABkB2f4C&pg=PA50|accessdate=10 August 2013|date=March 2009|publisher=Lancer Publishers|pages=50|id=GGKEY:6YYRQ10NHT0}}</ref> and was the second rank royal there, after then governor of the province, [[Mohammed bin Fahd|Prince Mohammed]].<ref name=wikileaks09>{{cite web|title=09RIYADH129|url=http://leaks.hohesc.us/?view=09RIYADH129|work=Guardiangate|accessdate=8 June 2012|date=19 January 2009}}</ref> His tenure lasted until his appointment as the governor of Al Bahah Province in 2010.<ref name=anews10/> It was speculated that he had support of [[Abdullah of Saudi Arabia|King Abdullah]] and was very close to [[Crown Prince Sultan|then-Crown Prince Sultan]] during his term.<ref name=wikileaks09/> Prince Mishari has stake in Imdadat Trading and Transport firm in [[Riyadh]] that he and his son, Turki, established in 1982.<ref name="SaudInCommerce"/>
On 28 August 2010, he was appointed governor of Al Bahah Province,<ref>{{cite web|title=About Saudi Arabia|url=http://www.saudiembassy.net/about/country-information/map_of_provinces.aspx|work=Saudi Embassy, Washington D.C.|accessdate=8 June 2012}}</ref> replacing his elder brother late [[Muhammed bin Saud|Prince Muhammed bin Saud]] who resigned from this post due to health problems.<ref name=anews10>{{cite news|last=Abdul Ghafour|first=P. K.|title=Mishari bin Saud is new Baha governor|url=http://arabnews.com/saudiarabia/article117231.ece|accessdate=6 April 2012|newspaper=Arab News|date=28 August 2010|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101102030548/http://arabnews.com/saudiarabia/article117231.ece |archivedate=2 November 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=قال لـ"العربية": سأبذل كل جهد ممكن لرِفعة المنطقة (Appointment of Mishari bin Saud to Al Baha province)|url=http://www.alarabiya.net/articles/2010/08/28/117872.html|accessdate=13 April 2012|work=Al Arabiya|date=28 August 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=مشاري بن سعود : سأسعى بكل جهد للارتقاء بالباحة (Mishary bin Saud: I will make every effort to improve the Baha)|url=http://www.aleqt.com/2010/08/29/article_435387.html|accessdate=14 April 2012|newspaper=Al Eqtisadiah|date=29 August 2010}}</ref>
== References == {{Reflist|colwidth=33em}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Saud, Mishari bin Saud bin Abdulaziz Al}} [[Category:1954 births]] [[Category:Grandsons of Ibn Saud|Saud, Mishari bin]] [[Category:Governors of provinces in Saudi Arabia]] [[Category:King Saud University alumni]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Saudi Arabian businesspeople]] [[Category:Saudi Arabian military personnel]]

{{About|the district in Berlin}} {{Infobox German location |name = Mitte |name_local = |image_photo = |image_caption = |of_city_coa = Coat_of_arms_of_Berlin.svg |type = Borough |article_ = of |City = Berlin |Town = |image_coa = Coat of arms of borough Mitte.svg |coordinates = {{coord|52|31|N|13|22|E|format=dms|display=inline,title}} |state = Berlin |district = |borough = |divisions = 6 localities |_office = |Bürgermeistertitel = |mayor = Stephan von Dassel |party = Grüne |elevation = |area = 39.47 |population = 374,000 |population_as_of = 2017-06-30 |density = |pop_ref = |postal_code = |area_code = |licence = B |free_2 = |free_2_txt = |year = |plantext = Location of Mitte in Berlin |image_plan = Berlin Bezirk Mitte (labeled).svg |website = [http://www.berlin-mitte.de Official homepage] }} '''Mitte''' is the first and most central [[boroughs and localities of Berlin|borough]] of [[Berlin]]. The borough consists of six sub-entities: [[Mitte (locality)|Mitte proper]], [[Gesundbrunnen (Berlin)|Gesundbrunnen]], [[Hansaviertel]], [[Moabit]], [[Tiergarten, Berlin|Tiergarten]] and [[Wedding (Berlin)|Wedding]].
It is one of the two boroughs (beside [[Friedrichshain-Kreuzberg]]) which comprises former [[West Berlin|West]] and [[East Berlin]] districts. Mitte encompasses Berlin's historic core and includes some of the most important tourist sites of Berlin like [[Museum Island]], the [[Fernsehturm Berlin|TV tower]], [[Checkpoint Charlie]], [[Brandenburg Gate]], [[Unter den Linden]], [[Potsdamer Platz]], [[Alexanderplatz]], the [[Reichstag building|Reichstag]] and [[Berlin Hauptbahnhof]], most of which were in former East Berlin.
When Berliners refer to ''Mitte'' they usually mean the smaller locality rather than the larger borough.
==Geography== [[File:Berliner Dom und Fernsehturm, 170117, ako.jpg|left|thumb|[[Berlin Cathedral]] and [[Fernsehturm Berlin|Television Tower]]]] Mitte ([[German language|German]] for "middle", "centre") is located in the central part of Berlin along the [[Spree]] River. It borders on [[Charlottenburg-Wilmersdorf]] in the west, [[Reinickendorf]] in the north, [[Pankow]] in the east, [[Friedrichshain-Kreuzberg]] in the southeast, and [[Tempelhof-Schöneberg]] in the southwest.
In the middle of the Spree lies Museum Island (''Museumsinsel'') with its museums and [[Berlin Cathedral]] (''Berliner Dom''). The central square in Mitte is [[Alexanderplatz]] with the prominent [[Fernsehturm Berlin|Fernsehturm]] (TV tower), Germany's highest building, and the large railway station with connections to many subway ([[Berlin U-Bahn|U-Bahn]]), tramway ([[Berlin tram|Straßenbahn]]), city trains ([[S-Bahn Berlin|S-Bahn]]) and buses.
There are some important streets which connect Mitte with the other boroughs, e.g. the boulevard Unter den Linden which connects Alexanderplatz to the west with Brandenburg Gate and runs further as [[Straße des 17. Juni]] to the [[Berlin Victory Column|Victory Column]] and the centre of former West Berlin in [[Charlottenburg]], or [[Karl-Marx-Allee]] from [[Alexanderplatz]] to [[Friedrichshain]] and the eastern suburbs.
==History== [[File:Berlin - Checkpoint Charlie 1963.jpg|thumb|[[Checkpoint Charlie]],1963]] The former Mitte district had been established by the 1920 [[Greater Berlin Act]] and comprised large parts of the historic city around [[Alt-Berlin]] and [[Cölln]]. Brandenburg Gate was the western exit at the Berlin city boundary until 1861.
Between 1961 and 1990, Mitte was the central part of East Berlin, however at the same time it was surrounded by the [[Berlin Wall]] at its north, south and west. There were some border control points, the most famous of which was [[Checkpoint Charlie]] between [[Kreuzberg]] and Mitte, which was operated by the [[United States Army]] and its allies and was open to foreigners and diplomats.
Two other checkpoints were at Heinrich-Heine-Straße/[[Prinzenstraße (Berlin U-Bahn)|Prinzenstraße]] east of Checkpoint Charlie, open to citizens of West Germany and West Berlin and on [[Invalidenstraße]] in the north on the border with the West Berlin Tiergarten district (the present-day [[Moabit]] locality).
== Regierungsviertel (Government District) == The government district is located in the locality of [[Tiergarten, Berlin|Tiergarten]] around the [[Reichstag building|Reichstag Building.]] Most institutions of the German government have their seat at the Regierungsviertel * [[Bundestag]], the German parliament in the old [[Reichstag building|Reichstag Building]] * [[Bellevue Palace (Germany)|Bellevue Palace]], seat of the [[President of Germany|Federal President]] * [[German Chancellery]] * Offices of the [[Abgeordnetenhaus of Berlin|Abgeordneten]], members of the parliament, in the ''Paul-Löbe-Haus'' and the ''Marie-Elisabeth-Lüders-Haus'' * [[Federal Ministry of the Interior (Germany)|Federal Ministry of the Interior]] <gallery> Berlin reichstag west panorama.jpg|Reichstag Building 2006-09-19 Berlin Bellevue.jpg|Bellevue Palace Bundeskanzleramt Berlin 2010.jpg|German Chancellery Reichstagsgebäude und Paul-Löbe-Haus, Berlin-Mitte, 170327, ako.jpg|Paul-Löbe-Haus Berlin, Tiergarten, Otto-von-Bismarck-Allee, Botschaft Schweiz.jpg|Swiss Embassy </gallery>
== Botschaftsviertel (Embassy Quarter) == Many embassies and the [[Federal Ministry of Defence (Germany)|Federal Ministry of Defence]] in the historic embassy quarter in the south of the [[Tiergarten (park)|Tiergarten Park]]. <gallery> Italienische Botschaft - panoramio.jpg|Italian Embassy Tiergarten Japanische Botschaft-002.JPG|Japanese Embassy Spanische Botschaft Fornt.jpg|Spanish Embassy Tiergarten Indische Botschaft.JPG|Indian Embassy Be Embassy of UAE 03.jpg|Embassy of the United Arab Emirates </gallery>
== Tiergarten Park == [[Tiergarten (park)|Großer Tiergarten]] is the name of the biggest urban park in Mitte, located in the [[Tiergarten, Berlin|same-named locality]]. The Tiergarten Park was established as a hunting ground in the 16th century by the Prussian kings. Today its enclosed by densely built-up areas by [[Hansaviertel]] and [[Moabit]] in the north, the Government District in the east and the [[City West]] and the Embassy Quarter in the southwest.
Many cultural monuments and memorials are located in the Tiergarten Park, like the [[Berlin Victory Column|Siegessäule]], the [[Soviet War Memorial (Tiergarten)|Soviet War Memorial]] and a historic rose garden. The [[Memorial to the Murdered Jews of Europe]], the biggest victim group of the Nazi-Diktatorship, is located on the east side of the park, near the [[Brandenburg Gate]] and the place where once [[Reich Chancellery|Hitler's New Reich Chancellery]] was. <gallery> Berlin Tiergarten Siegessaeule 2.jpg|Siegessäule Siegessaeule Aussicht 10-13 img4 Tiergarten.jpg|View from the Siegessäule to Brandenburg Gate Berlin Großer Tiergarten Rosengarten.jpg|Rose Garden Memorial to Homosexuals persecuted under Nazism.jpg|Memorial to Homosexuals Persecuted Under Nazism Memorial to the Murdered Jews of Europeabove.jpg|Memorial to the Murdered Jews of Europe </gallery>
== Kulturforum == [[File:Philharmonie 1a.jpg|thumb|[[Berliner Philharmonie|Philharmonie Berlin]]]] The Kulturforum was built in the 1950s and 1960s at the edge of [[West Berlin]], after most of the once unified city's cultural assets had been lost behind the [[Berlin Wall]]. The Kulturforum is characterized by its innovative modernist architecture; several buildings are distinguished by the organic designs of [[Hans Scharoun]], and the [[Neue Nationalgalerie]] was designed by [[Mies van der Rohe]].
Among the cultural institutions housed in and around the Kulturforum are: * [[Neue Nationalgalerie]] * [[Gemäldegalerie, Berlin|Gemäldegalerie]] * [[Kunstgewerbemuseum Berlin|Museum of Decorative Arts]] * [[Berlin Musical Instrument Museum|Musical Instrument Museum]] * [[Kupferstichkabinett Berlin|Kupferstichkabinett]] ([[Print room]]) * Art Library * [[Berliner Philharmonie]] * Chamber Music Hall * [[Berlin State Library]] * [[Ibero-American Institute]] * Wissenschaftszentrum * St. Matthäus-Kirche
== In arts and literature == *''[[Berlin Alexanderplatz]]'', a 1929 novel by [[Alfred Döblin]] *''[[Mitte 1]]'', a 2013 novel by [[Albrecht Behmel]] * ''Berlin Mitte'', [[Norman Ohler]] * ''Unter diesem Einfluss'', [[Henning Kober]]
==Subdivision== [[File:Berlin Mitte.svg|thumb|Subdivisions of Mitte]] The present-day borough of Mitte consists of six localities: {| |- | valign="top" | *[[Mitte (locality)|Mitte]] (the former Mitte borough) | valign="top" | *[[Moabit]] *[[Hansaviertel]] *[[Tiergarten (Berlin)|Tiergarten]] (the former Tiergarten borough) | valign="top" | *[[Wedding (Berlin)|Wedding]] *[[Gesundbrunnen (Berlin)|Gesundbrunnen]] (the former Wedding borough) |}
==Demographics== {{As of|2010}}, the district had a population of 322,919, of whom 144.000 (44.5%) had a migration background. In the former West Berlin areas of Wedding, Gesundbrunnen and Moabit, foreigners and Germans of foreign origin compose nearly 70% of the population, while in Mitte proper the share of migrants is relatively low. The immigrant community is quite diverse, however, [[Turkish people|Turks]], [[Sub-Saharan Africans|Africans]]{{who|date=April 2015}}, [[Eastern Europe]]ans {{who|date=April 2015}} and [[East Asia]]ns{{who|date=April 2015}} form the largest groups.<ref>http://www.statistik-berlin-brandenburg.de/Publikationen/Stat_Berichte/2011/SB_A1-5_hj02-10_BE.pdf</ref>
{| class="wikitable" |- class="hintergrundfarbe6" ! Percentage of people with migration background<ref>http://www.statistik-berlin-brandenburg.de/Publikationen/Stat_Berichte/201gnm1/SB_A1-5_hj02-10_BE.pdf{{dead link|date=February 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> |- | class="hintergrundfarbe5" | '''Germans without migration background/[[Ethnic Germans]]''' || class="hintergrundfarbe5" style="text-align:right;"| '''55.5 % (184.000)''' || |- | class="hintergrundfarbe5" | '''Germans with migration background, or Foreigners/Ausländer''' || class="hintergrundfarbe5" style="text-align:right;"| '''44.5 % (144.000)''' || |- | Muslim/Middle Eastern origin ([[Turkey]], [[Arab League]], [[Iran]] etc.) || style="text-align:right;"| 18.0% (60.000) || |- | non-German European origin ([[UK]], [[Netherlands]], United States, Russia, [[Poland]], Spain, France etc.) || style="text-align:right;"| 10.7% (35.400) || |- | Others ([[East Asia]]ns, [[Vietnamese people|Vietnamese]], [[Afro-Germans]], [[Sub-Saharan Africans]] etc.) || style="text-align:right;"| 14.5% (48.000) || |}
==Politics== [[File:Allocation of seats in the borough council of Mitte (DE-2016-10-27).svg|thumb|Sitzverteilung in der BVV|alt=Sitzverteilung in der BVV]] At the 2016 elections for the parliament of the borough (''Bezirksverordnetenversammlung'') the following parties were elected: *[[Social Democratic Party of Germany|SPD]] 14 *[[Alliance '90/The Greens]] 14 *[[The Left (Germany)|The Left]] 10 *[[Christian Democratic Union (Germany)|CDU]] 7 *[[Alternative for Germany]] 5 *[[Free Democratic Party (Germany)|Free Democratic Party]] 3 *[[Pirate Party Germany|Pirate Party]] 2 {{clear|both}}
==Twin towns== *{{flagicon|JPN}} [[Higashiōsaka, Osaka|Higashiōsaka]], Japan since 1959 *{{flagicon|ISR}} [[Holon]], Israel since 1970 *{{flagicon|GER}} [[Bottrop]], Germany since 1983 *{{flagicon|GER}} [[Schwalm-Eder-Kreis]] since 1992 *{{flagicon|JPN}} [[Shinjuku, Tokyo|Shinjuku]], [[Tokyo]], Japan since 1994 *{{flagicon|JPN}} [[Tsuwano, Shimane|Tsuwano]], Japan since 1995 *{{flagicon|FRA}} [[Tourcoing]], France since 1995 *{{flagicon|HUN}} [[List of districts in Budapest|VI. kerület]] (Terézváros), [[Budapest]], Hungary since 2005 *{{flagicon|RUS}} [[Central Administrative Okrug]], [[Moscow]], Russia since 2006 {{Wide image|View over Berlin Mitte.jpg|800px|View over Mitte from [[Berlin Cathedral]]}}
==See also== {{Portal|Berlin}} *[[Berlin Mitte (electoral district)]]
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== {{commons|Bezirk Mitte|Mitte}} *[http://www.berlin-mitte.de/ Official homepage] {{de icon}} *[http://www.berlin.de/en/ Official homepage of Berlin] {{en icon}}

page.title: National Operating Committee on Standards for Athletic Equipment

revision.comment: - 4 categories; ±[[Category:Standards organizations]]→[[Category:Standards organizations in the United States]] using [[WP:HC|HotCat]]
revision.text:
The '''National Operating Committee on Standards for Athletic Equipment''' (NOCSAE) is a [[non-profit organization]] operating in the [[United States]], whose mission is to reduce athletic injuries and death through standards and certification for [[athletic equipment]]. Schools and universities look to NOCSAE certification of equipment, particularly [[football helmet|helmets]], to protect players and reduce liability. NOCSAE data indicate a significant reduction in athlete fatalities and brain injuries when using NOCSAE-certified equipment. NOCSAE has been criticized for stifling innovation, holding a conflict of interest, and not furthering true player safety.
==Creation and early years== NOCSAE was organized in 1969 with the purpose of reducing death and injuries through the establishment of standards and certification for athletic equipment.<ref name=Wong /><ref name=Magee /> It does this through researching and testing equipment, developing new standards, and improving existing ones.<ref name=Wong />
NOCSAE's commissioning came in the wake of the death of 32 players in [[professional football (gridiron)|organized football]] in 1968 and subsequent concerns over safety of athletic equipment.<ref name=Magee /> Based on its limited funding, NOCSAE has narrowed its efforts from protective athletic equipment in all sports toward helmets' effectiveness in reducing injury, particularly in football, [[lacrosse]], and [[baseball]].<ref name=Magee /><ref name=Lipsey />
==NOCSAE standards, adoption, and effects== As a general matter, to be approved by NOCSAE, helmets must resist brain-injuring, concussive forces.<ref name=Magee /> Research from NOCSAE, in addition to targeting helmet safety standards, has also increased understanding of the mechanisms of head and neck injuries and the design and structure of helmets, headgear, and [[face mask (gridiron football)|face mask]]s.<ref name=Lipsey />
NOCSAE standards are adopted, if at all, on a voluntary basis. While a sport governing body may mandate that a piece of equipment be "NOCSAE approved", that is a rule or mandate of the governing body, not NOCSAE.<ref name=Hillman />
By 1973, NOCSAE had finalized and published a standard testing criteria for football helmets.<ref name=Magee /> The [[NCAA]] began advising its members to purchase helmets certified by NOCSAE beginning in 1975.<ref name=Nelson /> NOCSAE helmet standards were required in colleges in 1978 and in high schools in 1980.<ref name=Hillman />
Stickers indicating NOCSAE certification are placed onto helmets.<ref name=Amato /> Attorneys specializing in sports law advise schools and universities to purchase appropriate athletic equipment for the athletic activities offered that is of satisfactory quality, specifically football helmets that adhere to NOCSAE guidelines.<ref name=Wong /> School athletic staff are advised by experts to search for NOCSAE certification stickers, both as part of their athletic training education and day-to-day activities .<ref name=Wong /><ref name=Amato /> They are warned to do this, in particular, for liability reasons, as "serious legal reprecussions may occur if a helmet is issued to a student athletic " lacking an approval sticker.<ref name=Eaves />
NOCSAE reports that by 1985, the number of head injury fatalities had fallen significantly, with zero deaths in 1990, the first season with no deaths since reporting began in 1931.<ref name=Wong /> It also claims that the incidence of serious head injuries had fallen from 4.25 players per 100,000 in the late 1960s to 0.68 players per 100,000 in the late 1980s.<ref name=Wong />
==Board membership== The voting members of the NOCSAE board consists of representatives selected by their professional organizations, including:
* [[American Academy of Pediatrics]] * [[American College of Sports Medicine]] * [[American Medical Society for Sports Medicine]] * [[Athletic Equipment Managers Association]] * [[National Athletic Equipment Reconditioners Association]] * [[National Athletic Trainers' Association]] * [[Sporting and Fitness Industry Association]] * [[American Football Coaches Association]] * [[American Orthopedic Society for Sports Medicine]] and a non-voting representative from each the National Collegiate Athletic Association and the National Federation of State High School Associations.
==Criticisms== Critics note that NOCSAE has "a close working relationship with" the sporting goods industry,<ref name=Lipsey /> and that because NOCSAE is funded by those few companies, it has "an inherent conflict of interest".<ref name=Culverhouse /> They also claim that NOCSAE is not effective at lessening concussions and improving safety.<ref name=Culverhouse /> U.S. Senator [[Tom Udall]] of New Mexico requested that a federal agency, the [[Consumer Products Safety Commission]], assume an official role in helmet safety testing and certification, effectively displacing NOCSAE.<ref name=Culverhouse />
NOCSAE's certification standards have been criticized for authorizing helmet models that are "archaic or did not score well on specific impact tests."<ref name=Borden /> In addition, NOCSAE's tests focus on preventing [[Catastrophic injury|catastrophic injuries]] like skull fractures, not concussions.<ref name=Borden /> Observers note that such testing is equivalent to judging a car's safety based on its seat belts, with no consideration given to air bags.<ref name=Borden />
The sole reliance of the [[NFL]] on NOCSAE certification, without considering the tested safety results and other data on helmet models, has been criticized by the players' union.<ref name=Borden />
Critics note that while NOCSAE standards call for equipment to be reconditioned, where possible, and recertified every year,<ref name=Magee /> a school may keep its helmets as NOCSAE-certified simply by never submitting them for re-certification.<ref name=Nowinski />
The inflexible nature of NOCSAE guidelines, stemming from the hesitance of helmet manufacturers to take any risks that could lead to lawsuits,<ref name=Lipsey /> leads some to argue that innovative helmet designs may be underdeveloped.<ref name=Nowinski />
==References== <references> <ref name=Nowinski> {{cite book |last1=Nowinski |first1=Chris |authorlink1= |last2= |first2= |authorlink2= |editor1-first= |editor1-last= |editor1-link= |others= |title=Head Games: Football's Concussion Crisis from the NFL to Youth Leagues |trans-title=|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=pgH8Sk2FRi0C&pg=PA116&lpg=PA116&dq=NOCSAE |archiveurl= |archivedate= |format= |accessdate= |type= |edition= |series= |volume= |year=2006 |month= |origyear= |publisher= |location= |language= |isbn=9781597630139 |oclc= |doi= |id= |page= |pages=110, 116 |at= |trans-chapter=|chapter= |chapterurl= |quote= |ref= |bibcode= |laysummary= |laydate= |author-mask= |author-name-separator= |author-separator= |display-authors= |separator= |postscript= |lastauthoramp=}}</ref> <ref name=Eaves> {{cite book |last1=Eaves |first1=Ted |authorlink1= |last2= |first2= |authorlink2= |editor1-first= |editor1-last= |editor1-link= |others= |title=The Practical Guide to Athletic Training |trans-title=|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=hnFyJHg2N0AC&pg=PA36 |archiveurl= |archivedate= |format= |accessdate= |type= |edition= |series= |volume= |date= |year= {{Infobox officeholder |name = Nikolay Tsonev |office = [[Ministry of Defence (Bulgaria)|Minister of Defence]] |primeminister = [[Sergei Stanishev]] |term_start = 24 April 2008 |term_end = 27 July 2009 |predecessor = [[Veselin Bliznakov]] |successor = [[Nickolay Mladenov]] |birth_date = {{birth date and age|1956|6|9|df=y}} |birth_place = [[Pernik]], [[People's Republic of Bulgaria|Bulgaria]] |death_date = |death_place = |party = [[Bulgarian Communist Party]] (before 1989)
[[Independent politician|Independent]] (1989-2001)
[[National Movement for Stability and Progress|NMSP]] (2001-2012)
New Alternative (2012-present) |profession = [[Military]], [[Politician]], [[Businessman]] }}
'''Nikolay Georgiev Tsonev''' ({{lang-bg|Николай Георгиев Цонев}}; born 9 June 1956) is a Bulgarian officer, entrepreneur and politician from the [[National Movement for Stability and Progress]] after 2012 - from party New alternative. From 2008 to 2009 he was [[Minister of Defense]].
== Biography == Nikolay Tsonev was born on June 9, 1956 in Pernik. He graduated [[Georgi Dimitrov National MIlitary Artillery School|National Military Artillery School "Georgi Dimitrov"]] specialty "flak" from 1978 is an officer in the Bulgarian People's Army. During the 1986-1989 year studying at the Soviet military academy in Kiev. In 1992 dismissed from the army.
In subsequent years Tsonev participate in the management of several companies, including producer of bread "Nilana." In 1996 he graduated in accounting from the University of National and World Economy, and in 2005 - philosophy at Sofia University "St. Kliment Ohridski".
From 1999 to 2000 Nikolay Tsonev headed "Management of supply" in the [[Ministry of Defence]]. In 2001 he became an adviser to Defence Minister [[Nikolay Svinarov]] and in 2002 headed the agency for social activities to the ministry. On April 24, 2008 was appointed defense minister in the government of [[Sergei Stanishev]] and held that post until a change of Cabinet of 27 July 2009.
On June 24, 2012, the Constituent Assembly GOP "New Alternative" was elected chairman of the party. The party is centrist orientation and professed patriotic liberal ideas.
==Allegations and cases== In the months following the end of his tenure as defense minister Nikolay Tsonev is being investigated for abuses during his rule of the Ministry of Defence. On April 1, 2010 spectacular was arrested and charged with offering a bribe to an investigator at the time of his arrest deputy city prosecutor Roman Vasilev called Tsonev "absolute criminal".On October 28, 2012 was acquitted by Sofia City Court on that charge.
On June 1, 2012 Tsonev was acquitted by the Supreme Court in another case - to conclude a four unprofitable transactions in 1999 when the head of "Management of supply" in the Ministry of Defence.
Tsonev was convicted of attempting to bribe a magistrate.<ref>https://www.novinite.com/articles/125774/Prosecutor+Asks+5+Years+Jail+for+Ex+Bulgarian+Defense+Minister</ref><ref>[http://sofiaglobe.com/2015/02/03/bulgaria-high-court-acquits-former-defence-minister-in-bribery-case/ ''Sofia Globe'' article on Tsonev's aquittal]</ref> This has been cited as a key case of evidence of general corruption in Bulgaria's economy.<ref>[https://books.google.com/books?id=S7gbBQAAQBAJ&pg=PA175&lpg=PA175&dq=Nikolai+Tsonev&source=bl&ots=VOBlaQTyZb&sig=GJqozx0RtXj6DwaBnAzXw_kLl8w&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwj_m_Ku84XSAhXLxYMKHTA6Ag44ChDoAQgdMAE#v=onepage&q=Nikolai%20Tsonev&f=false ''Nationas in Transition: Democratization from Central Europe to Eurasia'', p. 175.]</ref> and in August 2015 ordered the prosecution of second instance to pay him compensation amounting to 15 thousand [[Bulgarian lev]].

{{distinguish|Panama Papers}} {{Use dmy dates|date=November 2017}}
[[File:Countries implicated in the Paradise Papers.svg|thumb|upright=1.50|Countries with politicians, public officials, or close associates named in the leak]]
{{Taxation}}
The '''Paradise Papers''' are a set of 13.4 million confidential electronic documents relating to [[offshore investment]]s that were leaked to the German reporters [[Frederik Obermaier]] and [[Bastian Obermayer]]<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.newyorker.com/news/news-desk/how-a-german-newspaper-became-the-go-to-place-for-leaks-like-the-paradise-papers|title=How a German Newspaper Became the Go-To Place for Leaks Like the Paradise Papers|last=Zerofsky|first=Elisabeth|date=2017-11-11|work=The New Yorker|access-date=2017-12-12|issn=0028-792X|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171223090008/https://www.newyorker.com/news/news-desk/how-a-german-newspaper-became-the-go-to-place-for-leaks-like-the-paradise-papers|archivedate=23 December 2017|df=dmy-all}}</ref> from the newspaper'' [[Süddeutsche Zeitung]]''. The newspaper shared them with the [[International Consortium of Investigative Journalists]],<ref name="ICIJ-20171105">{{cite news |author=Fitzgibbon, Will et al.|title=The 1 Percent – Offshore Trove Exposes Trump-Russia Links And Piggy Banks Of The Wealthiest 1 Percent – A new leak of confidential records reveals the financial hideaways of iconic brands and power brokers across the political spectrum.|url=https://www.icij.org/investigations/paradise-papers/paradise-papers-exposes-donald-trump-russia-links-and-piggy-banks-of-the-wealthiest-1-percent|date=5 November 2017|work=[[International Consortium of Investigative Journalists]]|access-date=5 November 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171105203706/https://www.icij.org/investigations/paradise-papers/paradise-papers-exposes-donald-trump-russia-links-and-piggy-banks-of-the-wealthiest-1-percent|archivedate=5 November 2017}}</ref> and a network of more than 380 journalists. Some of the details were made public on 5 November 2017 and stories are still being released.
The documents originate from legal firm [[Appleby (law firm)|Appleby]], the corporate services providers [[Estera]] and [[Asiaciti Trust]], and business registries in 19 tax jurisdictions.<ref name="BBC need to know">{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-41880153|title=Paradise Papers: All you need to know|date=5 November 2017|publisher=BBC|access-date=6 November 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171105232935/http://www.bbc.com/news/world-41880153|archivedate=5 November 2017}}</ref> They contain the names of more than 120,000 people and companies.<ref>"[https://www.bbc.com/news/business-41877932 Paradise Papers: Your guide to four years of offshore revelations] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171107042727/http://www.bbc.com/news/business-41877932|date=7 November 2017}}". BBC News. 5 November 2017.</ref> Among those whose financial affairs are mentioned are, separately, [[AIG]],<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/business-41877932 |title=Archived copy|accessdate=5 November 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171107042727/http://www.bbc.com/news/business-41877932|archivedate=7 November 2017}}</ref> [[Charles, Prince of Wales|Prince Charles]]<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.icij.org/investigations/paradise-papers/another-british-royal-found-offshore-connections|title=Another British Royal Found With Offshore Connections|author=Will Fitzgibbon|date=7 November 2017|publisher=ICIJ|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171111073115/https://www.icij.org/investigations/paradise-papers/another-british-royal-found-offshore-connections|archivedate=11 November 2017}}</ref> and [[Elizabeth II|Queen Elizabeth II]],<ref>{{cite web|title=Paradise Papers: Queen's private estate invested £10m in offshore funds|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-41878305|website=BBC News|publisher=BBC Panorama|access-date=5 November 2017|date=5 November 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171105181351/http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-41878305|archivedate=5 November 2017}}</ref> President of Colombia [[Juan Manuel Santos]], and [[United States Secretary of Commerce|U.S. Secretary of Commerce]] [[Wilbur Ross]].<ref name=bbc>{{cite web|title=Paradise Papers: Tax haven secrets of ultra-rich exposed|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-41876942|website=BBC News|publisher=BBC Panorama|access-date=22 February 2018|date=5 November 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171105181635/http://www.bbc.com/news/uk-41876942|archivedate=5 November 2017}}</ref> At 1.4 [[terabyte]]s in size, this is second only to the [[Panama Papers]] of 2016 as the biggest data leak in history.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/news/2017/nov/05/paradise-papers-leak-reveals-secrets-of-world-elites-hidden-wealth|title=Paradise Papers leak reveals secrets of the world elite's hidden wealth|last=Garside|first=Juliette|date=5 November 2017|work=The Guardian|access-date=11 November 2017|issn=0261-3077|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171111031347/https://www.theguardian.com/news/2017/nov/05/paradise-papers-leak-reveals-secrets-of-world-elites-hidden-wealth|archivedate=11 November 2017}}</ref>
