She had pledged to divest from more than 200 firms when she was confirmed as President Barack Obama's commerce secretary in 2013, but records show that she transferred [[assets]] to a company owned by her children's [[trust law|trust]]s, which shared the same address as her office.<ref name=donor>{{cite web|title=Big U.S. Political Donors Play The Offshore Game|publisher=ICIJ|date=7 November 2017|url=https://www.icij.org/investigations/paradise-papers/us-political-donors-play-offshore-game/|author=Spencer Woodman|accessdate=12 November 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171114124539/https://www.icij.org/investigations/paradise-papers/us-political-donors-play-offshore-game/|archivedate=14 November 2017|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
Economist [[Gabriel Zucman]] and his colleagues estimate that 63% of foreign profits made by American multinational corporations are stored in subsidiaries and offshore accounts, depriving the country of about $70 billion in tax revenue each year.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/11/12/opinion/paradise-papers-republicans-taxes.html|title=Paradise Papers Show How Misguided the G.O.P. Is on Taxes|author=Bryce Covert|date=November 12, 2017|publisher=New York Times|accessdate=November 18, 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171118071111/https://www.nytimes.com/2017/11/12/opinion/paradise-papers-republicans-taxes.html|archivedate=18 November 2017|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
=== South America ===
==== Argentina ==== Argentine Finance Minister [[Luis Caputo]] managed at least two [[Offshore bank|offshore]] [[Wealth management|wealth funds]].<ref name=perfil>{{cite web|url=http://www.perfil.com/paradisepapers/paradise-papers-salpico-al-gobierno-de-macri-el-ministro-luis-caputo-manejo-inversiones-en-islas-caiman.phtml|title=Paradise Papers salpicó al Gobierno de Macri: el ministro Luis Caputo manejó inversiones en Islas Caimán|work=Peril|date=5 November 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171105215607/http://www.perfil.com/paradisepapers/paradise-papers-salpico-al-gobierno-de-macri-el-ministro-luis-caputo-manejo-inversiones-en-islas-caiman.phtml|archivedate=5 November 2017|df=dmy-all}}</ref> Neither firm, the [[Cayman Islands]]–based Alto Global Fund, nor its [[Miami]]-based parent company Noctua Partners LLC, were listed in Caputo's financial disclosure statement, a statement that all public officials and candidates for office are required to make.<ref name=perfil /> Caputo is a first cousin of local industrialist and construction tycoon Nicolás Caputo, best friend of Argentine President [[Mauricio Macri]]. He told Argentine members of the ICIJ team that "it was an investment fund for friends and family."<ref name=perfil /> The funds, opened in 2009 and with over $100 million under management, remained under Caputo's management until December 2015, when Macri named him Finance Secretary, a post upgraded to Finance Minister this January.<ref name=perfil />
Argentine Energy Minister [[Juan José Aranguren]] managed two offshore companies, Shell Western Supply and Trading Limited and Sol Antilles y Guianas Limited, both subsidiaries of [[Royal Dutch Shell]]. One is the main bidder for the purchase of diesel oil by the current government through the state owned CAMMESA (Compañía Administradora del Mercado Mayorista Eléctrico).<ref name="perfil1">{{cite news|title=Aranguren: su paso por una offshore de Shell a la que el Estado le compró gasoil por US$ 150 M|url=http://www.perfil.com/paradisepapers/paradise-papers-aranguren-su-paso-por-una-offshore-de-shell-a-la-que-el-estado-le-compro-gasoil-por-us-150-m.phtml|accessdate=7 November 2017|work=[[Perfil]]|date=7 November 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171107155244/http://www.perfil.com/paradisepapers/paradise-papers-aranguren-su-paso-por-una-offshore-de-shell-a-la-que-el-estado-le-compro-gasoil-por-us-150-m.phtml|archivedate=7 November 2017|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
According to the papers, Argentine hotelier and real estate developer [[Alan Faena]] was director and CEO of half a dozen companies in the [[Cayman Islands]] and [[British Virgin Islands]]. Faena also appears with bank accounts in [[Luxembourg]] and the [[Isle of Man]], linked to different hotels and real estate projects in [[Puerto Madero]]. In the offshore firms he was associated with different investors such as Soviet-born British-American businessman [[Leonard Blavatnik]]; American billionaire [[J. Christopher Burch]] and his brother Robert Burch; American business and media executive [[John Augustine Hearst]]; and French designer [[Philippe Starck]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Alan Faena, otro argentino en Paradise Papers|url=http://www.perfil.com/paradisepapers/alan-faena-otro-argentino-en-paradise-papers-firmas-offshore-y-cuentas-en-suiza-y-luxemburgo.phtml|accessdate=7 November 2017|work=[[Perfil]]|date=7 November 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171107213019/http://www.perfil.com/paradisepapers/alan-faena-otro-argentino-en-paradise-papers-firmas-offshore-y-cuentas-en-suiza-y-luxemburgo.phtml|archivedate=7 November 2017|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
==== Brazil ==== {{See also|Operation Car Wash| Corruption in Brazil|Petrobras}} Agriculture Minister [[Blairo Maggi|Blairo Borges Maggi]] is mentioned in the papers.<ref name=explore>{{cite web|url=https://www.icij.org/investigations/paradise-papers/explore-politicians-paradise-papers/|title=Explore The Politicians in the Paradise Papers|publisher=ICIJ|accessdate=6 November 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171106011937/https://www.icij.org/investigations/paradise-papers/explore-politicians-paradise-papers/|archivedate=6 November 2017|df=dmy-all}}</ref> His company, Amaggi and LD Commodities, was first registered about five months after Maggi ended a term as governor of [[Mato Grosso]]. Maggi told Brazilian outlet ''Poder360'' that he was not a direct beneficiary of the company and he had never received money from it.
[[Henrique Meirelles|Henrique de Campos Meirelles]], the current Brazilian Minister of Finance, told ''[[Poder360]]'' that he does not report income from his Sabedoria Foundation because it was set up to perform charitable functions after his death and therefore he receives no income from it.<ref name=explore />
==== Chile ==== Alsacia-Express, which runs the debt-ridden public transit system of [[Santiago]], holds assets in a Bermuda bank, according to the Appleby documents.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://ciperchile.cl/2017/11/07/alsacia-express-los-secretos-en-islas-bermudas-del-mayor-operador-del-transantiago/ |publisher=Ciper |title=Alsacia Express: Los secretos en Islas Bermudas del mayor operador del Transantiago |date=November 7, 2017 |accessdate=November 26, 2017 |language=es |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171201044510/http://ciperchile.cl/2017/11/07/alsacia-express-los-secretos-en-islas-bermudas-del-mayor-operador-del-transantiago/ |archivedate=1 December 2017 |df=dmy-all }}</ref>
==== Colombia ==== [[File:Juan Manuel Santos Calderón - World Economic Forum on Latin America 2010.jpg|thumb|Colombian President [[Juan Manuel Santos]]]] President of [[Colombia]] (2010–2018) [[Juan Manuel Santos]] is mentioned in the investigation. He was part of two offshore societies.<ref>"[http://www.elmundo.es/internacional/2017/11/05/59ff586f22601dea7f8b460c.html Juan Manuel Santos, el yerno de Trump y la reina Isabel II, implicados en los Paradise Papers] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171108023135/http://www.elmundo.es/internacional/2017/11/05/59ff586f22601dea7f8b460c.html |date=8 November 2017 }}". ''El Mundo.'' 5 November 2017.</ref>
The singer [[Shakira]], while living in [[Barcelona]], is a resident of the Bahamas and sends her [[authors' rights]] revenue to Malta.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.lemonde.fr/paradise-papers/article/2017/11/07/la-chanteuse-shakira-place-des-millions-d-euros-de-droits-d-auteur-a-malte_5211594_5209585.html|title=La chanteuse Shakira place des millions d'euros de droits d'auteur à Malte|date=7 November 2017|work=Le Monde.fr|access-date=8 November 2017|language=fr|issn=1950-6244}}</ref>
== Public reaction == In the United Kingdom, the public reaction to the Paradise Papers has been relatively muted compared to similar leaks in the past, such as the [[Panama Papers]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2017/nov/10/protest-paradise-papers-micah-white |title=Why aren't the streets full of protest about the Paradise Papers? |publisher=''[[The Guardian]]'' |author=Micah White |date=10 November 2017 |accessdate=10 November 2017 |quote=The street-level response to the Paradise Papers, the mighty follow-up punch to last year's Panama Papers, has been curiously tepid. This is probably not what many activists, and the 100 media organizations involved in the leak, expected to happen. |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171110124851/https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2017/nov/10/protest-paradise-papers-micah-white |archivedate=10 November 2017 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> Possible reasons include the absence of overt illegality in the information; most media sources are careful to point out that the schemes in the Paradise Papers are generally lawful.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.scotsman.com/news/bill-jamieson-is-it-so-bad-to-avoid-tax-within-the-law-1-4608429 |title=Bill Jamieson: is it so bad to avoid tax within the law? |publisher=''[[The Scotsman]]'' |author=Bill Jamieson |date=9 November 2017 |accessdate=10 November 2017 |quote=Arguably most puzzling of all was the exact nature of the wrong doing. Both the Paradise Papers website and the BBC Panorama documentary ... repeatedly stressed that no laws had been broken and that UK tax due had been paid. Indeed, as the BBC documentary made clear, "the vast majority of the transactions involve no legal wrongdoing". |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171109111745/http://www.scotsman.com/news/bill-jamieson-is-it-so-bad-to-avoid-tax-within-the-law-1-4608429 |archivedate=9 November 2017 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> A statement on behalf of Queen Elizabeth confirmed that the Royal Estate paid full UK tax on her offshore investments.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-41878305|title=Paradise Papers: Queen's private estate invested £10m in offshore funds|publisher=BBC News|author=|date=6 November 2017|accessdate=10 November 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171106011244/http://www.bbc.com/news/uk-41878305|archivedate=6 November 2017|df=dmy-all}}</ref> Other public comments by notable popular public figures who appeared in the Papers may also play a part; Bono stated "I've been assured by those running the company that it is fully tax compliant, but if that is not the case, I want to know as much as the tax office does, and so I also welcome the audit they have said they will undertake."<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/music/news/bono-paradise-papers-u2-tax-offshore-investment-guernsey-malta-shopping-mall-statement-latest-a8044541.html |title=Paradise Papers: Bono says he welcomes investigation into offshore investment |publisher=''[[The Independent]]'' |author=Roisin O'Connor |date=9 November 2017 |accessdate=10 November 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171108213035/http://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/music/news/bono-paradise-papers-u2-tax-offshore-investment-guernsey-malta-shopping-mall-statement-latest-a8044541.html |archivedate=8 November 2017 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> Jack Peat has suggested that much of the media has ignored the story of the Paradise Papers because those media organisations are owned by individuals implicated in the papers, such as ''[[Daily Telegraph]]'' owners [[Barclay brothers|David and Frederick Barclay]], ''[[Daily Mail]]'' owner [[Jonathan Harmsworth]], and ''[[The Sun (United Kingdom)|The Sun]]'' and ''[[The Times]]'' owner [[Rupert Murdoch]].<ref>{{cite news |last=Peat |first=Jack |date=7 November 2017 |title=This is why there's been so little media coverage of the Paradise Papers |url=https://www.thelondoneconomic.com/news/theres-little-media-coverage-paradise-papers/07/11/ |work=The London Economic |access-date=12 November 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171113113109/https://www.thelondoneconomic.com/news/theres-little-media-coverage-paradise-papers/07/11/ |archivedate=13 November 2017 |df=dmy-all }}</ref>
After the leak, more than 30 [[Members of the European Parliament]] issued an open letter criticizing the British government for failing to take action against the offshore tax industry.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Osborne|first1=Hilary|last2=MacAskill|first2=Ewen|title=Britain criticised by MEPs for failing to take action on tax havens|url=https://www.theguardian.com/news/2017/nov/10/britain-criticised-meps-action-tax-havens-paradise-papers|accessdate=10 November 2017|work=[[The Guardian]]|date=10 November 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171110143004/https://www.theguardian.com/news/2017/nov/10/britain-criticised-meps-action-tax-havens-paradise-papers|archivedate=10 November 2017|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
[[Gavin St Pier]], an elected Deputy of the tax haven [[Guernsey]], stated that the "coverage was part of a well-orchestrated, ongoing campaign".<ref name=GStP>{{cite web |url=https://www.ft.com/content/38e99534-c48e-11e7-a1d2-6786f39ef675 |title=Paradise Papers shake Britain's offshore tax havens |publisher=''Financial Times'' |author=Vanessa Houlder |date=8 November 2017 |accessdate=8 November 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171109172213/https://www.ft.com/content/38e99534-c48e-11e7-a1d2-6786f39ef675 |archivedate=9 November 2017 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> He also averred that despite having the information since 2016, the timing of the release was deliberately delayed to coincide with the meeting of EU Finance Ministers ahead of the proposed discussion of a tax haven blacklist.<ref name=GStP />
Commenting on the Paradise Papers leak, United States Senator and 2016 presidential candidate [[Bernie Sanders]] warned of "rapid movement toward international oligarchy", saying, "The Paradise Papers shows how these billionaires and multinational corporations get richer by hiding their wealth and profits and avoid paying their fair share of taxes."<ref name=Sanders>{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/news/2017/nov/06/bernie-sanders-paradise-papers-leak-international-oligarchy|title=Bernie Sanders warns of 'international oligarchy' after Paradise Papers leak|publisher=''The Guardian''|accessdate=6 November 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171106190738/https://www.theguardian.com/news/2017/nov/06/bernie-sanders-paradise-papers-leak-international-oligarchy|archivedate=6 November 2017|df=dmy-all}}</ref> The [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democratic]] leader in the US Senate, [[Chuck Schumer]], and the ranking Democratic member of the Senate finance committee, [[Ron Wyden]], issued a joint statement accusing Republicans of "pushing a reform of the tax code that fails to close egregious loopholes revealed by the leaks."<ref name=Sanders />
==Litigation== On 18 December 2017 it was reported that Appleby had issued legal proceedings against the BBC and ''The Guardian'' for [[Breach of confidence in English law|breach of confidence]]. The BBC and ''The Guardian'' said they would "vigorously" defend the action.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-42403700|title=BBC and Guardian sued over Paradise Papers leaks|publisher=BBC News|date=18 December 2017|accessdate=24 December 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171221174814/http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-42403700|archivedate=21 December 2017|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
Appleby released a media statement to explain the necessity to seek legal action,<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.applebyglobal.com/media-statements/appleby-takes-legal-action.aspx|title=Appleby Media Statement|publisher=States of Jersey|date=20 December 2017|accessdate=20 December 2017}}</ref> and provided subsequent update.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.applebyglobal.com/media-statements/why-appleby-is-taking-legal-action-against-the-guardian-and-the-bbc.aspx|title=Appleby Media Statement|publisher=States of Jersey|date=26 January 2018|accessdate=26 January 2018}}</ref> ''The Guardian'' and the BBC settled the dispute with Appleby in May 2018.<ref>{{cite news |last=Tobitt |first=Charlotte |url=http://www.pressgazette.co.uk/guardian-and-bbc-settle-paradise-papers-dispute-with-offshore-law-firm-appleby/ |title=Guardian and BBC settle Paradise Papers dispute with offshore law firm Appleby |work=Press Gazette |date=22 May 2018 |accessdate=1 June 2018}}</ref>
In October 2018, Swiss-based multinational [[Glencore]] lodged a writ with the Australian High Court to prevent the use of Paradise Papers documents by the Australian Taxation Office in any legal action against the miner. Glencore asserted that the documents in question are subject to legal professional privilege. Glencore’s writ has four plaintiffs: Glencore International AG (an intermediate holding company resident in Switzerland), Glencore Investment Pty Ltd (a company incorporated in Australia), Glencore Australia Holdings Pty Ltd (a company incorporated in Australia) and Glencore Investment Holdings Australia Ltd (a company incorporated in Bermuda).<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.msn.com/en-gb/finance/news/glencore-seeks-injunction-against-tax-commissioner-to-prevent-use-of-paradise-papers/ar-BBNRXEJ|title=Glencore seeks injunction against tax commissioner to prevent use of Paradise Papers|publisher=The Guardian|date=4 October 2018|accessdate=9 October 2018}}</ref>
== See also == * [[Economic inequality]] * [[Offshore magic circle]] * [[Reginald Appleby]] * [[Taxation in Bermuda]] * [[Money laundering]] * [[Kleptocracy]]
== References == {{Reflist}}
== External links == {{Commons category}} * [http://www.whosaidso.org/index-concordance/papers/paradise/read-docs-2017-11-20.html Index to the Paradise Papers plus Concordance] * [http://www.afr.com/news/investigations Paradise Papers Portal] of ''[[The Australian Financial Review]]'' (Australia) * [https://www.thestar.com/news/paradise-papers.html Paradise Papers Portal] of the ''[[Toronto Star]]'' (Canada) * [http://www.lemonde.fr/paradise-papers/ Paradise Papers Portal] of ''[[Le Monde]]'' (France) * [https://projekte.sueddeutsche.de/paradisepapers/politik/the-new-offshore-leak-e969006/ Paradise Papers Portal] of ''[[Süddeutsche Zeitung]]'' (Germany) * [https://www.aftenposten.no/okonomi/i/oJQgR/Alt-om-dokumentlekkasjen-Paradise-Papers Paradise Papers Portal] of ''[[Aftenposten]]'' (Norway) * [https://web.archive.org/web/20171106000743/http://www.elconfidencial.com/www.elconfidencial.com/economia/paradise-papers/especial/ Paradise Papers Portal] of ''[[El Confidencial]]'' (Spain) * [https://www.svt.se/nyheter/15856279 Paradise Papers Portal] of [[Sveriges Television]] (Sweden) * [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/paradisepapers Paradise Papers Portal] of [[BBC News]] (United Kingdom) * [https://www.theguardian.com/news/series/paradise-papers Paradise Papers Portal] of ''[[The Guardian]]'' (United Kingdom) * [https://www.icij.org/investigations/paradise-papers/ Paradise Papers Portal] of [[International Consortium of Investigative Journalists]] (United States) * [https://www.occrp.org/en/paradisepapers/ Paradise Papers Portal] of the [[Organized Crime and Corruption Reporting Project|OCCRP]]

revision.text:
{{unreferenced|date=June 2014}} '''Partner relationship management (PRM)''' is a system of methodologies, strategies, [[software]], and [[web-based]] capabilities that help a [[vendor]] to manage [[Business partner|partner relationships]]. The general purpose of PRM is to enable vendors to better manage their partners through the introduction of reliable systems, processes and procedures for interacting with them.<ref>http://www.svcawards.com/files/Forrester%20Wave%20PRM%20Q4%202013.pdf</ref><ref>http://www.gartner.com/it-glossary/sales-focused-partner-relationship-management-prm</ref><ref>http://www.gartner.com/it-glossary/partner-relationship-management</ref> Web-based PRM systems typically include a [[Content Management System]], a partner and customer contact database, and the notion of a partner portal which allows partners to log in and interact with a [[vendor]]'s sales opportunity database and obtain product, pricing, and training information. There are a number of solution providers who offer PRM software companies who rely heavily on a PRM solution to stay relevant in their respective industries.
Vendors who implement a PRM solution are typically motivated by a need to reduce the financial overhead and establish new partnerships to drive channel revenue and scale. Partners may also be integrators or managed service providers.<ref>http://en.compubase.net/Partners-Resellers-ISVs-MSPs-Integrators-lists-for-business_a272.html</ref> Unlike [[Customer relationship management|CRM]] systems, which are tailored toward getting an end customer to purchase from you, a PRM system is focused on getting a partner to sell on your behalf. As a result, they commonly offer web-based self-service tools, information, and resources to partner resellers. Tools often include: * [[Market development funds|MDF]] Request Programs * Training, [[Certification]], and [[Accreditation]] Automation * [[Qualified prospect|Deal]] Registration Programs * Indirect [[Sales process|Sales Pipeline]] Reporting * Joint [[Business Plan]]ning * [[Bounty (reward)|Reward]] and [[Loyalty Program]]s * [[Digital library|Content Library]]
==Trends==
Gartner reports that PRM solutions have mainly been adopted by companies in the hardware technology, software technology, telecommunication, and manufacturing industries.<ref>https://www.gartner.com/technology/media-products/newsletters/impartner/1-34MYI19/gartner.html</ref>
The PRM application market has expanded significantly in the last 10 years, with vendors offering improved end-to-end and point solutions for the management of channel sales partners.<ref>https://www.gartner.com/technology/media-products/newsletters/impartner/1-34MYI19/gartner.html</ref>
== See also == * [[Customer relationship management]] (CRM) * [[Supplier relationship management]] (SRM) * [[Facility management]] (FM) * [[Software as a Service]] (SaaS)
== References == <!--- See [[Wikipedia:Footnotes]] on how to create references using <ref></ref> tags which will then appear here automatically --> {{Reflist}}

{{Use dmy dates|date=July 2013}} {{notability|Biographies|date=July 2011}}
{{ infobox person | name = Patricia Barbizet | image = Patricia Barbizet World Economic Forum 2013.jpg | caption = Patricia Barbizet at the [[World Economic Forum]] Annual Meeting in 2013 | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1955|4|17|df=yes}} | birth_place = [[Paris]], [[France]] | nationality = [[France|French]] | occupation = Businesswoman | education = [[ESCP Europe]] }}
'''Patricia Barbizet''' (born 17 April 1955) is a prominent figure in the French business world. She was appointed Chief Executive Officer of Christie’s in 2014, the first female CEO of the company.<ref>{{cite news| url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2014-12-02/christie-s-ceo-murphy-to-step-down-chairwoman-barbizet-promoted | work=Bloomberg | first=Mary | last=Romano | title=Christie's Names Barbizet First Woman CEO as Murphy Exits | date=2 December 2014}}</ref> She has been Executive Director of [[Groupe Artémis]] since 1992 and is Vice-Chairman of the Board ofKering (ex PPR) and Chairman of the Supervisory Board of Christie’s.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://investing.businessweek.com/research/stocks/people/person.asp?personId=1492154&ticker=PP:FP|title=Profile: Patricia Barbizet|publisher=Businessweek|accessdate=1 March 2013}}</ref>
== Biography == Daughter of film producer [[Philippe Dussart]] and painter Monique Cartier, Patricia Barbizet graduated from [[ESCP Europe]] in 1976.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://in.reuters.com/finance/stocks/officerProfile?symbol=AIRF.PA&officerId=663677|title=Patricia Barbizet|publisher=Reuters|accessdate=1 March 2013}}</ref> She began her career as an executive assistant with [[Renault]] in 1977.
She then held the positions of International Treasurer (1979 to 1982) followed by "Group Treasurer" of RVI (Renault Industrial Vehicles, which became [[Renault Trucks]]) until 1984, and finally CFO of [[RCI Banque|Renault Crédit International]] and Director of Renault Acceptance BV from 1984 to 1989.
In 1989, she joined the Pinault Group as Chief Financial Officer and was appointed Deputy Director-General for Finance and Communication of [[Pinault-CFAO]] (1990)<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.weforum.org/contributors/patricia-barbizet|title=Patricia Barbizet|publisher=World Economic Forum|accessdate=1 March 2013}}</ref> before becoming Managing Director of [[Artemis]], the investment company of the Pinault family. [[Artemis]] owns 40% of Kering, 100% of Christie’s, Chateau Latour, Le Point ... As such, she is Vice President of the Board of Kering (formerly [[Pinault-Printemps-Redoute]]), the world Number 3 in the luxury goods sector, Chairman of Christie’s International PLC and she serves on the boards of several of the Group’s companies (Gucci, Yves Saint Laurent...) She also serves as a qualified independent member of the Board of Total SA.
In 2015, she was ranked 6 in [[Fortune Magazine]]'s 50 Most Powerful Women EMEA.<ref>[http://fortune.com/most-powerful-women-europe-middle-east-africa/patricia-barbizet-6/]</ref>
On 20 November 2008, the President of the Republic appointed her to head the Investment Committee of the €20 billion [[Strategic Investment Fund]] (a subsidiary of the [[Caisse des Dépôts et Consignations]]).
In November 2012, she was honored by the international educational organization, [[Humanity in Action]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.humanityinaction.org/news_and_events/76-humanity-in-action-honored-patricia-barbizet-corinne-mentzelopoulos-and-ron-chernow|title= Humanity in Action Honored Patricia Barbizet, Corinne Mentzelopoulos and Ron Chernow|publisher=Humanity in Action|accessdate=15 January 2013}}</ref>
Her husband, [[Jean Barbizet]], former President of [[Barclays]] Capital France, headed the investment division of [[Barclays]] Bank.<ref>http://www.journaldunet.com/economie/dirigeants/couples/7-barbizet-barbizet.shtml</ref>
;Former mandates * Member of the board of Directors PSA Peugeot-Citroen (2013-2016) * member of the board of Directors Air France-KLM (2003-2013) * Member of the Board of Directors Bouygues-TF1 (2000-2013) * Head of the Investment Committee of the €20billion Strategic Investment Fund (public fund). * President (1980–82) then Honorary President of the French Association of Corporate Treasurers (AFTE) * Former President and CEO of [[SEFIMEG]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://managementscope.nl/manager/patricia-barbizet|title=Patricia Barbizet|publisher=Management Scope|accessdate=1 March 2013}}</ref> * Member of the [[Financial Markets Authority (France)|Financial Markets Authority]] (CMF) (1996–2002)
== Other activities == * She is chairman of the Board of Directors of the Philharmonie de Paris * She is a member of the Board of Directors of the [[Paris Opera]] and of RMN-Grand Palais
== References == {{Reflist|30em}}
{{authority control}}

{{Infobox person | name =Peter Busch Orthwein | image = | image_size = | caption = | birth_name = | birth_date = | birth_place = | death_date = | death_place = | death_cause = | resting_place = | resting_place_coordinates = | residence = | nationality =American | other_names = | known_for = Co-founder and Chairman of [[Thor Industries]] | education =[[Choate Rosemary Hall]]
[[Cornell University]] | employer = | occupation = Businessman, philanthropist, polo player | title = | salary = | networth = 400 Million | term = | predecessor = | successor = | party = | boards = | religion = | spouse =Susan Marston Haas
Beverly Miller | children =Peter Busch Orthwein, Jr.
Jennifer Orthwein
Lukens Busch Orthwein
Alexander Miller Orthwein
Jason Thornley Orthwein | parents =[[Adolphus Busch Orthwein]]
Mrs. David Metcalfe | relatives =[[Adolphus Busch]] (paternal great-great-grandfather)
[[Stephen A. Orthwein]] (brother) | box_width = }} '''Peter Busch Orthwein''' is an [[United States|American]] heir, businessman and [[polo]] player. He is the co-founder and Chairman of [[Thor Industries]] ({{nyse|THO}}). ==Early life== His father was [[Adolphus Busch Orthwein]] and his mother, Mrs. David Metcalfe.[https://www.nytimes.com/1987/05/10/style/beverly-miller-is-married-to-peter-busch-orthwein.html Beverly Miller Is Married To Peter Busch Orthwein], ''[[The New York Times]]'', May 10, 1987 His paternal great-great-grandfather was [[Adolphus Busch]] (1839–1913), the founder of [[Anheuser-Busch]]. He has five brothers: Adolphus B. Orthwein II, [[Stephen A. Orthwein]], David Orthwein, Christopher Orthwein, and Michael Montgomery.Horace A. Laffaye, ''Polo in the United States: A History'', Jefferson, North Carolina: McFarland & Company, 2011, pp. 207-208'Westport Ceremony Joins Haas-Orthwein', ''Palm Beach Daily News'', December 31, 1972 [https://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=1961&dat=19721231&id=8jojAAAAIBAJ&sjid=vowFAAAAIBAJ&pg=4570,54005] He was educated at [[Choate Rosemary Hall]], a boarding-school in [[Wallingford, Connecticut]].'Susan Haas To Marry', ''[[Palm Beach Daily News]]'', November 09, 1972 [https://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=1961&dat=19721109&id=wTojAAAAIBAJ&sjid=vowFAAAAIBAJ&pg=6916,1978169] He graduated from [[Cornell University]] in [[Ithaca, New York]] in 1968, where he was the captain on the polo team and a member of [[Quill and Dagger]].Horace A. Laffaye, ''Polo in the United States: A History'', Jefferson, North Carolina: McFarland & Company, 2011, pp. 168-169 He went on to receive a Masters in Business Administration degree from Cornell in 1969.Laura McGrath ,[http://www2.johnson.cornell.edu/alumni/enterprise/spring2013/index.cfm?action=inside&inside_id=26&alum=4 Paying It Forward], ''Cornell Enterprise Online'', January 2012 ==Business career== He started his career at [[Bankers Trust]], and later worked for [[Gould Electronics]]. In 1980, together with Wade F. B. Thompson, he co-founded [[Thor Industries]], an American manufacturer of recreational vehicles and mid-sized commercial buses.[http://ir.thorindustries.com/about-thor/our-history/default.aspx Thor Industries: Our History][http://ir.thorindustries.com/corporate-governance/management-team/default.aspx Thor Industries: Management Team][https://www.forbes.com/profile/peter-orthwein/ Forbes: Peter Orthwein][http://investing.businessweek.com/research/stocks/people/person.asp?personId=308303&ticker=THO Bloomberg BusinessWeek: Peter B. Orthwein] It became a public company in 1984, and it joined the [[New York Stock Exchange]] in 1986. He served as its chairman from 1980 to 1986, vice chairman from 1986 to November 2009 and treasurer from 1980 to November 2009. He then served as its president from 2009 to 2012. Additionally, since November 2009, he has served as its chairman and chief executive officer. On August 1, 2013, he stepped down as CEO but remained chairman. He also served as chairman and CEO of [[Dutchmen Manufacturing]] from November 2009 to August 1, 2013. ==Polo== In 1969, he played on the Plainsmen team with his brother Stephen, John Armstrong and Charles Armstrong. That year, they came second at the finals of the Royal Windsor Cup at the [[Guards Polo Club]], losing to the Lushill team (Captain Frederick Barker, [[Howard Hipwood]], Peter Perkins, and Peter Gifford). They also lost in the semifinals of the Gold Cup at the [[Cowdray Park Polo Club]] at [[Cowdray Park, West Sussex]] against the Windsor Park team (Lord Patrick Beresford, his brother [[John Beresford, 8th Marquess of Waterford]], [[Prince Philip, Duke of Edinburgh]] and Paul Withers). He is a player in residence at the [[Greenwich Polo Club]] in [[Greenwich, Connecticut]].[http://greenwichpoloclub.com/about/players/ Greenwich Polo Club: Players] In 2015, [[Peter M. Brant]] honored Orthwein by naming one of the polo fields at the Greenwich Polo Club in his honor.Brant honored Peter Busch Orthwein, co-founder of Thor Industries, by naming one of the polo fields at the Greenwich Polo Club in his honor. ==Philanthropy== He has endowed the Peter B. Orthwein '69 Head Coach of Polo, the Class of 1969 Scholarship (in honor of Professor Jerry Hass) and the Peter B. Orthwein 1968 Sesquicentennial Fellowship in Accounting at his alma mater, Cornell University. ==Personal life== On December 30, 1972, he married Susan Marston Haas, the daughter of [[George Haas, Jr.]] (1920-2006) of the Haas Financial Corporation, at the [[Christ & Holy Trinity Church]] in [[Westport, Connecticut]].'Orthwein-Haas', ''[[The Chronicle of the Horse]]'', Volume 36, Issues 1-13, p. 75 [https://books.google.com/books?id=lkZQAAAAYAAJ&q=%22Peter+Busch+Orthwein%22&dq=%22Peter+Busch+Orthwein%22&hl=en&sa=X&ei=IvRhUqnnDOLT0QXxhICgCQ&ved=0CDsQ6AEwAg] The reception was at the [[Fairfield County Hunt Club]]. On May 9, 1987, he married Beverly Miller, a paintings appraiser at [[Sotheby's]], at the [[Church of the Heavenly Rest]] on the [[Upper East Side]] in New York City. His son, Peter Busch Orthwein, Jr., received an M.B.A. from Cornell University in 2003. ==References== {{Reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Orthwein, Peter Busch}} [[Category:20th-century births]] [[Category:Year of birth missing (living people)]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Greenwich, Connecticut]] [[Category:Choate Rosemary Hall alumni]] [[Category:Cornell University alumni]] [[Category:American chief executives]] [[Category:American philanthropists]] [[Category:American polo players]] [[Category:Busch family]]

{{Infobox theatre | name = Plaza Theatre | image = The_Plaza_Theatre.JPG | image_size = | image_alt = | caption = | image_map = | map_caption = | pushpin_map = | pushpin_map_caption= | address = 125 Pioneer Plaza | city = [[El Paso, Texas]] | country = [[United States]] | designation = | owner = [[El Paso, Texas|City of El Paso]] | tenant = | operator = [[SMG (property management)|SMG]] | capacity = Kendle Kidd Performance Hall: 2000
Philanthropy Theatre: 200 | type = | opened = September 12, 1930 | reopened = March 17, 2006 | yearsactive = | rebuilt = | closed = | demolished = | othernames = | production = | currentuse = | website = {{URL|http://elpasolive.com}} {{Infobox NRHP | embed = yes | name = Plaza Theatre | nrhp_type = | image = | caption = | locmapin = Texas#USA | map_label ={{PAGENAMEBASE}} | locmap_relief = yes | coordinates = {{coord|31|45|31|N|106|29|11|W|display=inline,title}} | built = {{Start date|1929}} | builder = C.A. Goetting | architect = W. Scott Dunne | architecture = [[Colonial Revival architecture|Colonial Revival]], [[Spanish Colonial Revival architecture|Spanish Colonial Revival]] | added = June 4, 1987 | area = {{convert|1|acre}} | refnum = 87000902{{NRISref|version=2010a}} }} }} The '''Plaza Theatre''' is a historic building in [[El Paso, Texas]] built in 1930. The theater stands as one of the city's most well-known landmarks,{{Cite book|title = Famous Places in El Paso History: A Bilingual Picture and Activity Book|last = Natividad|first = Maria Almeida|publisher = Galeria del Sol|year = 2015|isbn = 9780986184307|location = El Paso, Texas|pages = 33}} and remains operational today. The theatre is a [[National Register of Historic Places|National Historic Building of Significance]] featuring the 2,050-seat Kendall Kidd Performance Hall, and the smaller 200-seat Philanthropy Theatre. It hosts [[Broadway theatre|Broadway productions]], musical concerts, individual performers and the annual Plaza Classic Film Festival.{{cite web|url=http://elpasolive.com/venues/plaza_theatre|title=Plaza Theatre|last=|first=|date=August 17, 2018|website=El Paso Live}} ==History== Prior to the Plaza Theatre being built, there had been a large produce warehouse, belonging to Bernard and Ben Schuster, which occupied the location on Pioneer Plaza.{{Cite book|title = El Paso: Guided Through Time|last = Metz|first = Leon|publisher = Mangan Books|year = 1999|isbn = 9780930208370|location = El Paso, Texas|pages = 56–58}} In February 1927, the owner of the principal El Paso theaters, Louis L. Dent, bought the property on Pioneer Plaza with the stated intention of doing something good for the city of El Paso. Upon purchase of the property, he told the [[El Paso Times]], "El Paso has been good to me, and I am going to put something everybody will proud of." In 1929, construction of the [[Spanish Colonial Revival architecture|Spanish Colonial Revival style]] Plaza Theater began. It was designed by the prolific Dallas architect W. Scott Dunne, who is credited with more than 30 theaters in Texas and Oklahoma. Today the Plaza is recognized as his surviving masterpiece. H. Ponsford & Sons built the theater,{{Cite book|title = El Paso Chronicles: A Record of Historical Events in El Paso, Texas|last = Metz|first = Leon|publisher = Mangan Books|year = 1993|isbn = 9780930208325|location = El Paso, Texas|pages = 219–220}} and constructed by C.A. Goetting Construction Company. The Plaza was designed as a modern film house in a Spanish Colonial revival style with the flexibility of presenting stage shows. Construction was completed in 1930.{{Cite book|title = El Paso: A Borderlands History|last = Timmons|first = W.H.|publisher = Texas Western Press|year = 1990|isbn = 0874042070|location = El Paso, Texas|pages = 236–237, 274}} The [[Wurlitzer|Wurlitzer Company]] installed a $60,000 [[pipe organ]]. It was advertised as the "largest theater of its kind between [[Dallas]] and [[Los Angeles]]."{{Cite journal|url = http://www.thc.state.tx.us/public/upload/publications/medallion-march-april-2011.pdf|title = Escape to El Paso|last = |first = |date = March 2011|journal = The Medallion|doi = |pmid = |access-date = 14 August 2015|page = 10|publisher = Texas Historical Commission}} Opening night was on September 12, 1930 with the movie "Follow Through" to a capacity crowd of 2,410. Although several theaters existed in downtown El Paso at the time the Plaza Theatre opened, its size, elaborate decor, and technical innovations made it stand out. It was advertised as the largest theater of its kind between [[Dallas, Texas|Dallas]] and [[Los Angeles, California|Los Angeles]]. The Plaza has been a [[vaudeville]] or burlesque house as well as also showing movies. The theater featured an "atmospheric" ceiling complete with twinkling stars which were astronomically correct stars and projections of lazily floating clouds. It was the first public theater in the [[United States]] with [[air conditioning]]. In 1933, Interstate Theaters purchased the Plaza Theatre. On February 10, 1934, the Plaza's very first stage drama, ''[[Richelieu (play)|Richelieu]]'', was performed. The cast included then famous Walter Hampton, [[Dallas Anderson (actor)|Dallas Anderson]], [[John Davenport (actor)|John Davenport]] and Mable More. In 1939, the theater showed ''[[Gone with the Wind (film)|Gone With the Wind]]'' in two different showings because of [[Jim Crow laws]] in El Paso. The first showing was whites only, but a [[Civil Rights Movement|civil rights]] activist, [[Betty Mary Goetting]], prevailed on the Plaza Theatre to show a midnight screening which [[African American]]s could attend. The midnight show of ''Gone With the Wind'' was reported to be "packed." In 1949, the Plaza hosted the world premier of the film "[https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0041332/ El Paso]," which drew a capacity and star-studded crowd, and also showed [[Thomas C. Lea, III|Tom Lea's]] "The Brave Bulls." ===Decline=== By the 1950s, two major influences factored into a slow decline in the Plaza Theatre's patronage. The advent of [[television]] and the rise of [[Suburb|suburban neighborhoods]] located farther and farther away from downtown served as major challenges to the Plaza Theatre in addition to other downtown establishments. At the same time, a new source of competition arose with the advent of [[drive-in theater]]s in the late 1940s. By the early 1970s, the theater had fallen into disrepair, and was sold. Many of its impressive amenities, including furnishings, artwork, and the Mighty Wurlitzer Organ were auctioned off. Only by the acquisition of the theater by the local Dipp Family in 1973 was the Plaza saved from demolition at that time. The Plaza closed on May 31, 1974. In 1985, the state of Texas declared the Plaza Theatre to be a Historical Landmark. It was briefly reopened in 1970 and 1980, only to finally close its doors in 1989. In 1989, after years of infrequent programming, the decision was made to demolish the Plaza Theatre in order to make way for a parking lot. Spurred by a groundswell of community support, the El Paso Community Foundation began negotiations to raise the required $9 million to save the theater from demolition. With only six weeks to raise the funds, fundraising events were held across the community with the most visible effort being staged by actress [[Rita Moreno]] the day before the deadline. It was announced that evening that enough money had been raised to save the Plaza Theatre. After the El Paso Community Foundation placed a new roof on the theater, it was donated to the [[El Paso, Texas|City of El Paso]] in 1990. Even though this theater was falling, it was still trying to pull itself up. ===Reopening=== One of the few remaining theaters of its kind in the country, the Plaza had lost most of its original splendor. Furnishings and artwork had been removed, the facade had been altered, and parts of its once-advanced electrical systems were no longer functional, yet the interior structure appeared as it had for close to seventy years. In 2000, a volunteer steering committee, assembled by the El Paso Community Foundation, began to assess the viability of restoring the Plaza Theatre. The committee concluded that the project was feasible, and in 2001, a leading promoter, producer and marketer of live entertainment events, conducted an extensive survey of El Paso's local performing arts community. The survey concluded that: a market did exist in El Paso for additional performing arts programming, and that the public had a strong affinity for the Plaza and was eager to attend events at a restored Plaza. On July 30, 2002 the City of El Paso formally approved a public/private partnership with the El Paso Community Foundation to restore the Plaza Theatre to its original appearance. The Foundation committed to raising $12 million towards the renovation effort, to restoring and reinstalling the Mighty Wurlitzer Organ at the Plaza Theatre, and to donating the adjacent building (Centre Annex), which would be integrated into the overall operations of the Plaza. The City of El Paso agreed to fund the remaining cost of the restoration. [[Thos. S. Byrne, Ltd.]] and Arrow Builders were hired to perform the restoration. The companies took particular interest in the project, noting that "With over 2,000 seats at the commencement of restoration, the Plaza is currently one of the nation's largest non-functioning theaters in the United States." The companies worked diligently to insure all phases of construction complied with historical restoration guidelines. At a cost of nearly $38 million, the Plaza reopened on March 17, 2006. The first performance hosted at the refurbished theater was [[Riverdance]] which played Friday, March 17, 2006 through Sunday, March 19 with multiple sold-out performances. The reopened theater boasts a 2,050-seat main theater with a 10-story stage house capable of handling large traveling Broadway shows. In addition, with the completion of the Centre Annex, the facility includes a 200-seat children's theater, a rooftop garden, meeting facilities and a privately managed restaurant. The smaller theater is named the [http://www.plazatheater.org/philanthropy.sstg Philanthropy Theatre]. Despite the completion of the project, the El Paso Community Foundation continues appropriating funds to buy back original art and furnishings of the Plaza. ==The building== [[File:Plaza Theater at Night.jpg|alt=Plaza theater at night.|thumb|The Plaza Theater at night.]] No expense was spared in creating the elaborate building. At the point where the entrance wing of the Plaza adjoined the auditorium, a domed tower rises in three tiers, projecting above the roof line. Other exterior references to the [[Spanish Colonial Revival Style architecture|Spanish mission-style]] included modest brick delineations at the building's corners, simple [[Cartouche (design)|cartouche]] motifs and stepped and curved parapets with tile accents along the roof line. While the exterior facade was designed to be reminiscent of a mission-style parapet, patrons were awed by the interior, with its intricately [[fresco|painted ceilings]], [[mosaic]]-tiled floors, Posh carpeting, decorative wrought iron banisters and sconces and, to heighten the effect, antique furnishings. Due to such [[Rococo|grandiose rococo]] design, the Plaza became known as "The Showplace of the Southwest." ===The Mighty Wurlitzer=== Further emphasis of the illustrious interior stands in the $60,000 [[Wurlitzer organ#Theatre organs|Mighty Wurlitzer Organ]], designed to elevate from the [[orchestra pit]] to accompany vaudeville shows, sing-alongs, and to entertain patrons before and after films. Its "toy box" provides the organ with the versatility to replicate such sounds as horses' hooves, the ocean surf and birds chirping. The organ had 15 ranks with 61 pipes in each rank. In 1973, the Mighty Wurlitzer Organ was sold at auction and housed at the home of a private collector in Dallas. In 1998 the organ was restored and returned to El Paso as a donation by the late Karl O. Wyler, Sr.. During renovations of the theater, the organ was put on display at [[Sunland Park Mall]] located in [[Northwest El Paso]] The organ was rebuilt by Pipe Organ Artisans of Arizona, Tucson, and re-installed. The Opus 2123 console was returned to its original finish. It is the only one of its kind (a Wurlitzer Balaban III) left intact.{{Cite web|url = http://www.epcf.org/news_detail.sstg?id=90|title = Organ Artisans Tackle a|date = 11 October 2005|accessdate = 14 August 2015|website = |publisher = |last = |first = |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20070928122624/http://www.epcf.org/news_detail.sstg?id=90|archivedate = 28 September 2007}} ==Trivia== * Through the years, the Plaza hosted such popular entertainers as [[Roy Rogers]] and [[Dale Evans]], the [[Barrymore family]], [[Sally Rand]], [[Tallulah Bankhead]], [[Hopalong Cassidy]], [[John Wayne]], the [[Marx Brothers]], [[Rita Moreno]], [[Henry Fonda]], [[Tom Mix]], and [[James Stewart]]. * The original [[seating capacity]] was 2,410, with 1,510 seats on the main floor, 508 in the mezzanine and 392 in the balcony. Before reopening, the seating accommodations were diminished to provide future patrons with wider, more comfortable seating. * Originally, [[Colored|colored patrons]] were only allowed to sit in the balcony of the theater. The main seating was segregated as [[White people|white]] seating only. * The Plaza had one [[fallout shelter]] located beneath the stage. Prior to restoration, food rations could still be found within the shelter with the original packagings intact. ==See also== {{Portal box|NRHP|Texas}} *[[National Register of Historic Places listings in El Paso County, Texas]] ==References== {{reflist}} == External links == {{Commonscat|Plaza Theatre (El Paso)|Plaza Theatre}} *[http://www.interstatetheatres.com Plaza Documentary] *[http://www.theplazatheatre.org/ Official site] *[http://www.epcf.org/ The El Paso Community Foundation] *[http://epcc.libguides.com/content.php?pid=309255&sid=2621835 El Paso Community College] *[http://plaza-movies.com/index.php] {{National Register of Historic Places in Texas|state=expanded}} {{El Paso}} [[Category:Buildings and structures in El Paso, Texas]] [[Category:Culture of El Paso, Texas]] [[Category:Downtown El Paso, Texas|Plaza Theatre]] [[Category:Landmarks in Texas|Plaza Theatre]] [[Category:Theatres in Texas|Plaza Theatre]] [[Category:National Register of Historic Places in El Paso County, Texas]] [[Category:Economy of El Paso, Texas]] [[Category:Spanish Colonial Revival architecture in Texas]] [[Category:Tourist attractions in El Paso, Texas]] [[Category:Theatres on the National Register of Historic Places in Texas]] [[Category:Public venues with a theatre organ]]

revision.text:
{{Infobox alpine ski racer |name=Hubertus of Hohenlohe-Langenburg |image= Hubertus von Hohenlohe - Amadeus Awards 2013.jpg |disciplines=[[Downhill (ski competition)|DH]], [[super G|SG]], [[giant slalom|GS]], [[slalom skiing|SL]], [[alpine combined|combined]] |club= |birth_date={{birth date and age|1959|2|2}} |birth_place=[[Mexico City]], [[Mexico]] |height= |wcdebut=December 12, 1981 |retired= |website=[http://www.hubertushohenlohe.com/ www.hubertushohenlohe.com] |olympicteams=6 ([[Mexico at the 1984 Winter Olympics|1984]], [[Mexico at the 1988 Winter Olympics|1988]], [[Mexico at the 1992 Winter Olympics|1992]], [[Mexico at the 1994 Winter Olympics|1994]], [[Mexico at the 2010 Winter Olympics|2010]], [[Mexico at the 2014 Winter Olympics|2014]]) |olympicmedals=0 |olympicgolds=0 |worldsteams=17 (1982, 1985, 1987, 1989, 1991, 1993, 1996, 1997, 1999, 2001, 2003, 2005, 2009, 2011, 2013, 2015, 2017) |worldsmedals=0 |worldsgolds=0 |wcseasons=13 |wcwins=0 |wcpodiums=0 |wcoveralls=0 |wctitles=0 }} '''Prince Hubertus of Hohenlohe-Langenburg''' (born 2 February 1959 in [[Mexico City]] as '''Hubertus Rudolph zu Hohenlohe-Langenburg'''; {{IPA-es|uˈβeɾt̪us ruˈðolf su oẽnˈloe.lãŋxẽmˈbuɾɣ}}) is a [[Mexico|Mexican]] [[Alpine skiing|Alpine skier]], photographer, businessman, and a pop singer known as '''Andy Himalaya''' and '''Royal Disaster'''. He belongs to a family which [[reign]]ed over a principality in what is now the northeastern of [[Baden-Württemberg]] in Germany until the early 19th century.<ref>He possesses [[dual citizenship]] in the country of his birth, Mexico, and in the country of his legal domicile, Liechtenstein. While Mexican law does not recognize [[nobility]] or [[hereditary title]]s, Liechtenstein recognizes both.</ref>
==Life== A son of [[Prince Alfonso of Hohenlohe-Langenburg]] and [[Princess Ira von Fürstenberg]], Hubertus was born in [[Mexico City]], [[Mexico]] where his father ran a [[Volkswagen]] factory. His grandmother is half [[Mexican people|Mexican]].<ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.time.com/time/world/article/0,8599,1963932,00.html | work=Time | title=Why Is a German Prince Skiing For Mexico? | date=2010-02-13 | accessdate=2010-05-22}}</ref> He lived in Mexico for the first four years of his life and then moved to Spain. He later studied in Austria and his main residence was in [[Vienna]], where he works as a photographer and artist. Although he has Mexican nationality, which makes him eligible to compete for Mexico, he only spends a few weeks a year there. He is fluent in several languages and grew up in [[Europe]], mainly [[Austria]]. Hohenlohe had a brother named [[Prince Christoph of Hohenlohe-Langenburg|Christoph]] (1956–2006) and has two half-sisters (Arriana Mara and Désirée). He currently resides in [[Liechtenstein]], of which he is also a citizen.<ref>{{cite news|title=Mexikos Skifahrer tritt in Sotschi als Mariachi an|url=http://www.n24.de/n24/Nachrichten/n24-netzreporter/d/4189914/mexikos-skifahrer-tritt-in-sotschi-als-mariachi-an.html|work=[[N24 (Germany)|N24]] Nachrichten|accessdate=8 February 2014}}</ref> His uncle [[Max von Hohenlohe]] competed at the 1956 Winter Olympics. He is first cousins with [[Prince Marco of Hohenlohe-Langenburg]].
Hubertus acted as co-producer for [[Yello]] and [[Shirley Bassey]]'s 1987 collaborative single "[[The Rhythm Divine]]".<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.discogs.com/Yello-Featuring-Shirley-Bassey-The-Rhythm-Divine/release/1198073 |title=Yello Featuring Shirley Bassey – The Rhythm Divine |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |website=[[Discogs]]|access-date=14 March 2016}}</ref>
Hubertus has work on display with the [[Art of the Olympians]] <ref>http://artoftheolympians.org/artists/hubertus-von-hohenlohe/</ref>
==Sports career== Hohenlohe founded the [[Mexican Ski Federation]] in 1981.<ref name=SI-2015-03-06> {{cite magazine |url= https://www.si.com/edge/2015/03/06/prince-hubertus-von-hohenlohe-mexican-ski-team |title= Mariachi Man: Prince Hubertus and the Mexican ski team he helped create |author= Tik Root |date= 6 March 2015 |publisher= Sports Illustrated }} </ref> He first skied for Mexico at a Winter Olympics at the [[1984 Winter Olympics|1984 games]] in [[Sarajevo]], and managed to finish 26th in slalom. After the 1984 Winter Olympics, Hohenlohe managed to participate in [[1988 Winter Olympics|1988]], [[1992 Winter Olympics|1992]], and [[1994 Winter Olympics|1994]] Games.<ref name=NYT-2017-11-17> {{cite news |url= https://www.nytimes.com/2017/11/17/sports/olympics/nigeria-has-an-olympic-bobsled-team-and-tonga-had-a-luger.html |title= Nigeria Has an Olympic-Level Bobsled Team, and Tonga Had a Luger |author= Victor Mather |date= 17 November 2017 |publisher= New York Times }} </ref> He qualified for the [[2006 Winter Olympics]] in [[Turin]], [[Italy]], but the Mexican [[Olympic Committee]] decided not to send a one-man team to the Winter Games that year.
Hohenlohe has stated that the only reason why he continues to participate is because it seems that the "exotic skiers" (those from countries without a tradition in winter sports) are disappearing, and that he wants to keep that tradition alive.<ref name=SI-2015-03-06/> Since 1982, he has participated in 15 World Championships and set a World Record.{{Citation needed|date=February 2007}} Hohenlohe was expected to retire following the [[2007 Alpine Skiing World Championships]], after breaking his leg during a World Cup slalom race on January 28, 2007, eliminating him from the competition in [[Åre]].<ref>[http://www.skiracing.com/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=4728&Itemid=2]</ref>
He came back to competition in 2009 and competed in his 12th World Championship, the [[2009 Alpine Skiing World Championships]].
Hubertus was the sole athlete in the [[Mexico at the 2010 Winter Olympics|Mexican team]] at the [[2010 Winter Olympics]]. He participated in two alpine skiing disciplines, the [[Alpine skiing at the 2010 Winter Olympics – Men's giant slalom|Men's Giant Slalom]] (78th) and the [[Alpine skiing at the 2010 Winter Olympics – Men's slalom|Men's Slalom]] (46th).<ref>http://www.vancouver2010.com/olympic-alpine-skiing/athletes/hubertus-von-hohenlohe_ath1056076cr.html</ref> At 51, he was the oldest athlete at the games.<ref>http://www.vecernji.hr/sport/vijesti/ivan-sola-je-sa-47-godina-medu-starcima-igara-clanak-99893</ref> He also competed at the [[2014 Winter Olympics]],<ref>{{cite web|last=Zaccardi|first=Nick|title=Prince Hubertus von Hohenlohe of Mexico will be second oldest Winter Olympian ever|url=http://olympictalk.nbcsports.com/2014/01/02/prince-hubertus-von-hohenlohe-of-mexico-will-be-oldest-olympian-skier/|work=NBC Olympic Talk|accessdate=2 January 2014}}</ref> where he was Mexico's sole athlete again. He participated in slalom but did not finish after a fall during the first run.<ref>[http://www.globalpost.com/dispatch/news/afp/140222/olympics-mexican-mariachi-von-hohenlohe-crashes-out-slalom Olympics Mexican mariachi von Hohenlohe crashes out slalom] ''Global Post'', retrieved 28 February 2014</ref>
In 2015, he was joined by [[Sarah Schleper]] on the Mexican ski team, doubling its size.<ref name=SI-2015-03-06/>
von Hohenlohe, affectionately called ''El Príncipe'', mooted retiring for 2017,<ref name=SI-2015-03-06/> but instead decided to qualify for the [[2018 Winter Olympics]]. <ref name=2017-02-23> {{cite news |url= https://www.aol.com/article/news/2017/02/23/mexican-prince-eyes-title-as-oldest-winter-olympian-ever/21718797/ |title= Mexican prince eyes title as oldest Winter Olympian ever |publisher= AOL |date= 23 February 2017 }} </ref> Another two hopes for [[Alpine Mexico]], aside from Hubertus, and Schleper, are [[Rodolfo Dickson]] and [[Jocelyn McGillivray]]. Additionally, three more hope to represent Mexico, [[Robby Franco]] in freestyle skiing, [[Sandra Hillen]] in snowboard and [[German Madrazo]] in Cross-country skiing. <ref name=ESPN-2017-10-31> {{cite news |url= http://www.espn.com/blog/onenacion/post/_/id/8098/tres-company-for-the-mexico-ski-team-in-the-winter-olympics |title= 'Tres' company for the Mexico ski team in the Winter Olympics |author= Adriana Terrazas |date= 31 October 2017 |publisher= ESPN }} </ref><ref name=eSportesMX-2017-05-18> {{es icon}} {{Cite web |url= http://www.esportes.mx/tres-mexicanos-acudiran-a-pyeongchang-2018/ |title= Tres mexicanos acudirán a Pyeongchang 2018 |date= 18 May 2017 |publisher= Esportes.MX }} </ref><ref name=SIPSE-2017-08-11> {{es icon}} {{cite news |url= https://sipse.com/deportes/mexico-presente-juegos-olimpicos-invernales-2018-deportes-264676.html |title= México estará presente en los Juegos Olímpicos Invernales de 2018 |date= 11 August 2017 |publisher= SIPSE.com }} </ref><ref name=EBD-2017-02-23> {{cite web |url= https://elbigdata.mx/sport-data/cuarta-parte-mexico-con-cuatro-o-cinco-atletas-a-pyeongchang-2018/ |title= México con cuatro o cinco atletas a Pyeongchang 2018 |date= 23 February 2017 |author= Carlos Alberto Cruz |publisher= El Big Data }} </ref> He failed to qualify for the 2018 Olympics, but designed the race suits for the Mexican alpine skiers. .<ref> {{Cite news |last=Boren |first=Cindy |date=11 February 2018 |title=The Mexican Olympic ski team's Day of the Dead uniforms will haunt you |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/early-lead/wp/2018/02/11/the-mexican-olympic-ski-teams-day-of-the-dead-uniforms-will-haunt-you/ |newspaper=The Washington Post}} </ref>

'''Romano Artioli''' (born 1932)<ref>Paolo Artemi, ''Bugatti, la fabbrica di sogni'' in [[Corriere della Sera]] (Dec 28, 1993)</ref> is an [[Italy|Italian]] entrepreneur and one-time owner of [[Bugatti]] and [[Lotus (car)|Lotus]] automobile brands.
Artioli was born in [[Moglia]] in the [[Province of Mantua]], and raised in [[Bolzano]] where in the 1980s he ran one of the largest [[Ferrari]] dealerships in the world, selling in northern Italy and southern Germany.<ref>See [[Automobile Quarterly]], vol. 46, issue 2 (2006)</ref> He also imported Japanese cars, owning ''Autoexpò'' which in 1982 became the first Italian importer of [[Suzuki]].<ref>Maurizio Caldero, ''Buon compleanno Suzuki: da 25 anni anche in Italia'' in [[La Repubblica]] (June 7, 2007).</ref>
He had a large collection of Bugatti automobiles,{{Citation needed|date=August 2009}} and was encouraged by [[Ferruccio Lamborghini]] and Paolo Stanzani to establish ''Bugatti International'', a holding company that bought the Bugatti trademark name in 1987. Artioli became chairman of [[Bugatti#Bugatti Automobili S.p.A.|Bugatti Automobili S.p.A.]], which made the [[Bugatti EB 110]] between 1991 and 1995. In 1993, his wife Renata Kettmeir formed the [[Bolzano]]-based ''Ettore Bugatti'' luxury item maker, also using the Bugatti "EB" logo. Their involvement ended in September 1995 due to [[bankruptcy]],<ref>John Tagliabue, ''Hard Times for a Dream Car's Descendant'' in ''[[New York Times]]'' (November 23, 1995)</ref> and the company was eventually bought by [[Volkswagen]] in April 1998. Prior to the sale to Volkswagen, private equity Investor CVC Ventures (a Citibank company) attempted a purchase of Bugatti via UK corporate finance advisor Anglo American Ventures however the £100m deal failed at due diligence stage.
Artioli purchased [[Lotus (car)|Lotus]] from [[General Motors Corporation|General Motors]] in August 1993 and became its chairman until 1996 when he stepped down to be Special Projects director until 1998. He sold a majority stake to [[Proton (car)|Proton]] in 1996 to fund his losses due to the insolvency of Bugatti.
His daughter [[Elena Artioli]] (born 1970) is a politician for the [[South Tyrolean People's Party]] and [[Lega Nord Alto Adige – Südtirol]].<ref>[http://www.elenaartioli.com/ elenaartioli.com] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20091011100544/http://www.elenaartioli.com/ |date=2009-10-11 }}</ref> The [[Lotus Elise]] was named after Romano Artioli's granddaughter Elisa Artioli.
